content:
はなび〔花火〕
〈名〉Fireworks; a pyrotechnic display

content.content: 花火を上げる(打上げる)
to let off fireworks―set off fireworks
あれ花火が上がった
There go the fireworks!
今晩両国に花火がある
There is a display of fireworks―a pyrotechnic display―a pyrotechnic exhibition―at Ryogoku this evening.
仕掛花火
a set piece
花火製造所
pyrotechnics
花火師
a pyrotechnist

はなふだ〔花札〕
〈名〉The flower-cards (the Japanese playing-cards)

はなふぶき〔花吹雪〕
〈名〉A flower-drift

content:
パナマ
〈固名〉Panama

content.content: パナマ運河
the Panama Canal
パナマ帽
a Panama hat

content:
はなみ〔花見〕
〈名〉Flower-viewing

content.content: 春は花見
The cherry-trees blossom in spring.
花見に行く
to go to see the cherry-blossoms―so flower-viewing―go on a flower-viewing excursion
花見遊山
a flower-viewing picnic―a picnic under the cherry-blossoms
上野は花見の人でいっぱいだ
Ueno is thronged with flower-viewers.
花見会
a cherry-party
花見舟
a cherry-party boat
病人を控えて花見でもあるまい
With an invalid to care for, a cherry-party is not to be thought of.

content:
はなみ〔花実〕
〈名〉Flower and fruit

content.content: 死んで花実が咲くものか
Death ends all―There is nothing after death.

content:
はなみ〔歯並〕
〈名〉A set of teeth

content.content: 君は歯並が好い
You have a regular set of teeth―a beautiful set of teeth.
あの女は歯並みが悪い
She has an irregular set of teeth.

はなみず〔鼻水〕
〈名〉Nasal mucus; snivel

はなみち〔花道〕
〈名〉The raised passage leading to the Japanese stage

はなみね〔鼻峯〕
〈名〉The bridge of the nose

はなむけ〔餞〕
〈名〉A parting present; a farewell present:(=する) to make (one) a farewell present

content:
はなむこ〔花婿〕
〈名〉A bridegroom

content.content: 花婿の付添人
a groom's man―one's best man

はなむしろ〔花蓆〕
〈名〉Flowered matting; fancy matting

はなめがね〔鼻眼鏡〕
〈名〉A pince-nez

はなもうせん〔花毛氈〕
〈名〉A flowered carpet

はなもじ〔花文字〕
〈名〉A capital letter

はなもちがならぬ〔鼻持ちがならぬ〕
〈形〉Nauseous (smell); disgusting (manner); loathsome (fellow); intolerable (manner); insufferable (English, etc.)

content:
はなもとじあん〔鼻元思案〕
〈名〉Short-sighted views

content.content: あの人は鼻元思案だ
He can not see beyond his nose.

はなもよう〔花模様〕
〈名〉Flower design

content:
はなやか〔華やか〕
〈形〉Flowery (style); florid (music); gorgeous (dress); gay (costume, etc.)

content.content: 華やかな歌
a flowery song
華やかな音楽
florid music
華やかな言葉
flowery language―flourishes
彼の文は華やかな文句に満ちている
This style is full of flourishes.
華やかな文体
a florid style
華やかな生活
a gay life
娘どもは華やかに装っている
The girls are gorgeously dressed―gaily dressed.
華やかな吹奏
a flourish of trumpets―a fanfare

content:
はなよめ〔花嫁〕
〈名〉A bride

content.content: 花嫁の付添婦人
a bridesmaid
花嫁ぶりが好い
She brides it well.

はなれ〔離れ〕
〈名〉A detached room; a detached building

はなれうし〔離れ牛〕
〈名〉A stray cow:(集合的に言えば)stray cattle

はなれうま〔離れ馬〕
〈名〉A stray horse

はなれざしき〔離れ座敷〕
〈名〉A detached room

ばなれする〔場馴れする〕
〈自動〉To get used to the stage; to get over one's stage-fright

はなれた〔離れた〕
〈形〉Detached (building); secluded (from the world); stray (cattle, etc.)

content:
ばなれた〔場馴れた〕
〈形〉Practiced; experienced; easy-mannered

content.content: あれば場馴れた女だ
She has easy manners.
彼の演説は場馴れたもんだ
He is used to the platform―an old hand at public-speaking.

content:
はなればなれに〔離れ離れに〕
〈副〉Separately; apart

content.content: 離れ離れになる
to separate―become separated―scatter―be scattered―break up
一家離れ離れになる
A family breaks up―A home is torn up.
夫婦が離れ離れになる
Husband and wife separate.
親子が離れ離れになっている
Parents and children are separated.
離れ離れにする
to put two apart―(夫婦なら)―separate man and wife―(一家なら)―scatter a family―break up a family

はなれや〔離れ家〕
〈名〉A detached building

content:
はなれる〔離れる〕
〈自動〉To come off; to come loose; to get loose; to fall apart; to come asunder; to separate (from something); to become disjoined (from something); to be estranged (from a friend); to be apart (from each other); to be distant (from a place)

content.content: 本の表紙が離れる
The cover comes off.
製本が悪いと本の紙がバラバラに離れる
If the binding is bad, the sheets fall apart―come asunder.
紐が離れた
The string has come loose.
馬が離れる
A horse gets loose―breaks loose.
馬が離れた
A horse is loose!
舟が離れる
A boat gets adrift.
舟が離れた
The boat is adrift!
縫い目が離れる
A seam falls apart.
米国は英国から離れた
America separated from England.
二人は離れられぬ(離るべからざる関係がある)
The two are inseparable―bound up in each other.
友と離れる
to be estranged from a friend
そこはここからよほど離れている
The place is far distant from here―a long way from here.
海岸から少し離れて小島がある
There is an islet at some distance from the shore.
道路から少し離れて立派な門がある
There is a fine gate a little way off the road.
油絵は少し離れて見るものだ
An oil-painting should be looked at from a distance―An oil-painting shows best at a distance.
建物と建物が二間離れている
The buildings stand 12 feet apart (from each other).
二人は遠く離れている
The two are far apart from each other.
遠く離れて
When far apart are we,
会えない時は
And can't each other see,
月が鏡と
I wish the moon could be
成れば好い
A mirror clear to me!
離れるな(くっついて来い)
Keep close to me!
我々は離れないようにしよう
Let us keep together!

content: 〈他動〉To leave (a person or a place); to clear, get clear of (land); to get out (of bed); to rise from (table); to depart from (custom); to deviate from (the course); to break from (the procession); to digress from (the subject); to wander from (the point); to stray from (the path of duty); to seclude oneself from (the world)

content.content: 食卓を離れる
to rise from table
床を離れる
to get out of bed
病床を離れる
to rise from a sick-bed
汽車がステーションを離れる
A train leaves the station―clears the station―gets clear of the station.
汽車はステーションを離れた
The train is clear of the station.
ステーションを離れると海が見える
When you get clear of the station, you get a view of the sea.
村を離れるとその山が見える
When you get clear of the village, you will have a view of the mountain.
船が陸を離れる
A ship clears the land―gets clear of the land―bears away from the land.
船が海岸を離れぬ
A ship hungs the shore.
老人が炉ばたを離れぬ
The old man hugs the chimney-corner.
地面を離れる
to rise off the ground
列を離れる
to fall out of the line
にわかに行列を離れる
to break from the procession
本題を離れる
to digress from the subject―wander from the point
本題を離れないで
Keep to the point!
習慣を離れる
to depart from custom―leave the beaten track
船が航路を離れる
A ship deviates from her course.
扶持に離れる、職に離れる
to be thrown out of employment
彼は職に離れて困っている
He is badly off for employment―out of employment―(賤役者なら)―out of collar.
職に離れてぶらついている
He is at a loose end.
子が親の手を離れる
A son leaves his parents―becomes independent of his parents.
親の膝元を離れる
to bid adieu to one's paternal roof
この子は親の膝元を離れたことが無い
He never left his parents' side.
正道を離れる
to leave the right path―deviate from the path of right―stray from the path of duty
水を離れた魚
a fish out of water
利益を離れて考えなければならぬ
The question must be considered apart from interest.
商売気を離れて彼に尽した
She served him apart from interest.
子どもが乳を離れる
A child is weaned (from its mother).
片足突込んでも慾を離れぬ
With one foot in the grave, he con not wean his mind from worldly desires.
世を離れる
to seclude oneself from the world
彼は世を離れて暮らしている
He lives in seclusion.
浮世を離れた閑静なところ
a place secluded from the world―a secluded spot
都を離れた辺鄙な村
a village remote from towns―a remote village
塵の世を離れて清き生活を送っている
Aloof from the dusty world―“Far from the madding crowd's ignoble strife”―“Remote from towns”―he runs his godly race.
椅子を離れる
to rise off one's chair

はなれわざ〔離れ業〕
〈名〉A feat:(米国にては)a stunt

content:
はなわ〔花輪〕
〈名〉A wreath; a garland

content.content: 花輪を作る
to wreathe flowers (into a garland)―wreathe a garland of flowers

content:
はにかみや〔羞み屋〕
〈名〉A shy person; a bashful person

content.content: あの人ははにかみ屋だ
He is shy―bashful.
この子ははにかみ屋で困ります
She can not get over her shyness―can not get over her bashfulness.

content:
はにかむ〔羞む〕
〈自動〉To be shy; to be bashful; to be coy:(形容詞に用いれば)shy; bashful; coy

content.content: はにかむ子だ
She is a shy girl―a bashful maiden.
はにかんで困る
She can not get over her shyness―can not get over her bashfulness.

content:
ばにく〔馬肉〕
〈名〉Horse; horseflesh

content.content: 西洋では馬肉を食うか
Do they eat horse in foreign countries?

はにわ〔埴輪〕
〈名〉A clay image (exhumed from old mounds, which was used to prevent the self-immolation of vassals on the death of their lords)

はぬう〔端縫う〕
〈他動〉To sew the borders of (cloth); to hem (a handkerchief, etc.)

はね
〈名〉(=芝居や寄席のはね)The end (of a performance):(=る) to end

content:
はね〔羽根〕
〈名〉
1. (=羽毛)a feather:(装飾用の羽根)a plume:(総称すれば)plumage

content.content: 鳥に羽根が生える
A bird is fledged.
羽根の生えたての鳥
a fledged bird―a fledgling
まだ羽根の生えない鳥
an unfledged bird―a callow bird
羽根が抜ける
A feather falls out.
鳥が羽根を整える
A bird plumes its feathers―preens its feathers―lays its feathers―trims its feathers.
鶏は今羽根が抜け換わる時だ
The hens are moulting.
羽根のついた帽子
a plumed hat
ダチョウの羽根
ostrich plumes
孔雀は羽根が綺麗だ
The peacock has a beautiful plumage.

content: 2. (=羽翼)a wing

content.content: 鳥が羽根を拡げる
A bird spreads its wings.
羽根をすぼめる
A bird folds its wings.
大きなワシは羽根の先から先まで二間もある
A large eagle will measure 12 feet from tip to tip of its wings.
羽根が欲しや
How I wish for a pair of wings!―O for a pair wings!
羽根があったら飛んでも行くが
If I had wings, I would fly to you.
羽根が生える
to grow wings
本は羽根が生えて飛ぶように売れる
The books is selling like wildfire.

content: 3. (=才能)ability; talent; genius

content.content: 羽根を充分に伸ばす
to give free play to one's ability―give ample scope to one's talent―give full swing to one's genius

content: 4. (=羽子)a shuttlecock

content.content: 羽子板
a battledore
羽根をつく
to play (at) battledore and shuttlecock

content:
はね〔跳泥〕
〈名〉Splashes of mud

content.content: 着物にはねが上がっている
One's clothes are spattered (with mud)―bespattered (with mud).
着物にはねを上げる
to spatter one's clothes (with mud)―bespatter one's clothes (with mud)
はねの上がった靴
bespattered boots

content:
ばね〔弾機〕
〈名〉A spring

content.content: この戸はばね仕掛になっている
The door works by a spring.

はねあがり〔跳上がり〕
〈名〉A lively girl; a minx; a hoyden; a filly

content:
はねあがる〔跳上がる〕
〈自動〉To jump up; to leap up; to spring up; to spring to one's feet

content.content: 市場がはね上がる
The market jumps.

はねいた〔羽根板〕
〈名〉A battledore

はねいた〔撥ね板〕
〈名〉A spring-board

はねおきる〔跳ね起きる〕
〈自動〉To jump up; to spring to one's feet

はねかいし〔跳ね反し〕
〈名〉Recoil (of a gun)

はねかえす〔跳ね反す〕
〈他動〉To repel

はねかえり〔跳ね反り〕
〈名〉
1. Rebound
2. (=跳ね反り娘)a hoyden; a minx

はねかえる〔跳ね反る〕
〈自動〉To spring back; to rebound; (a gun) recoils, kicks; (a shell) ricochets

はねがきする〔羽根掻きする〕
〈自動〉(A bird) plumes its feathers, preens its feathers, lays its feathers, trims its feathers

はねかける〔跳ね掛ける〕
〈他動〉To splash (water); to spatter (mud)

content:
はねかす〔跳ねかす〕
〈他動〉To splash (one with water); to spatter, bespatter (one with mud)

content.content: 自動車が泥を跳ねかして行った
A motor-car spattered me (with mud)―bespattered me (with mud).
水撒車が水を跳ねかして行った
A water-cart splashed me with water.

はねだす〔撥ね出す〕
〈他動〉To reject (anything as ineligible)

はねちらす〔跳ね散らす〕
〈他動〉To splash (water, etc.)

content:
はねつき〔羽根突き〕
〈名〉(The game of) battledore and shuttlecock

content.content: 羽根つきをする
to play (at) battledore and shuttlecock

content:
はねつける〔撥ね付ける〕
〈他動〉To reject (a proposal); to repel (an offer); to repulse (one's advances); to rebuff (one's overtures); to spurn at (a favour); to refuse (a request)

content.content: 先方の相談をはねつけてやった
I rejected his proposal―repelled his offer―repulsed his offer―spurned at his offer.
断然撥ねつけられた
I met with a flat refusal.
ばかなことを言うといって頭からはねつけられた
He pooh-poohed the idea.

content:
はねつるべ〔撥ね釣瓶〕
〈名〉A sweep-bucket

content.content: はねつるべ井戸
a well with a sweep

はねとばす〔跳ね飛ばす〕
〈他動〉To send (anything) flying

はねに〔撥ね荷〕
〈名〉Rejected goods; a rejected lot

はねのく〔跳ね退く〕
〈自動〉To spring aside; to spring back

はねのける〔撥ね退ける〕
〈他動〉To reject (anything as ineligible)

はねばし〔跳ね橋〕
〈名〉A drawbridge

はねぶとん〔羽根蒲団〕
〈名〉A feather-bed; a down-bed

はねぼうき〔羽根箒〕
〈名〉A feather-brush

はねまわる〔蹴ね廻る〕
〈自動〉(Children) jump about, frolic, gambol, caper, skip; (girls) romp; (kittens and puppies) frisk

はねもの〔撥ね物〕
〈名〉A rejected article; rejected goods

はねよけ〔跳泥除け〕
〈名〉A dashboard; a splashboard; a splasher

はねる
〈自動〉(=芝居や寄席がはねる)(A public performance) ends

content:
はねる〔跳る〕
〈自動〉To jump; to leap; to spring; to bound; (girls) romp; (horses) prance, curvet, plunge; (fishes) flounce; (water) splashes; (mud) spatters; (charcoal) cracks

content.content: 鯉が跳ねる
A carp leaps out of the water.
馬が跳ねる
A horse prances.
跳ねる馬
a prancing horse―a skittish horse
魚がバタバタ跳ねる
A fish flounces.
小鳥がピョンピョン跳ねて歩く
A little bird hops along.
着物に泥が跳ねた
My clothes are spattered (with mud)―bespattered (with mud).
着物に血が跳ねた
His clothes were splashed with blood.
火が跳ねる
The fire cracks.
箍が跳ねる
A hoop springs (off the tub).

content:
はねる〔刎ねる〕
〈他動〉To cut off (one's head)

content.content: 首をはねる
to cut off one's head―behead one―decapitate one―(首にするの意味なら)―dismiss one―cashier one
首をはねられた
He had his head cut off―He was beheaded―decapitated―(首にされたの意味なら)―He was dismissed―cashiered.
頭はねる、上前はねる
to squeeze―take commission―(米国にては)―take graft
給料の頭はねる
to cheat the men of their pay
親方が一円ずつ頭はねる
Their boss squeezes one yen from each.
賃銀から一割頭はねられる
The men have ten percent squeezed out of their wages.
泥棒の上前はねる
to outwit a lawyer

content:
はねる〔撥ねる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=省く)to reject (anything as ineligible); to pluck (a candidate)

content.content: 合格しない品は皆はねられる
All the goods that do not pass muster are rejected―condemned.
試験ではねられる(落第する)
to get plucked

content: 2. (=水をはねる)to shed (water)

content.content: 雨合羽は水をはねる
A rain-coat sheds water.
鳥の毛は水をはねる
Water slides off a bird's back.
フランネルは汗をはねる
Flannel does not get moist with sweat.

content:
はのね〔歯の根〕
〈名〉The root of a tooth; a fang

content.content: 怖くて歯の根が合わなかった
My teeth chattered for fear.

content:
パノラマ
〈名〉A panorama

content.content: パノラマ館
a panorama-house
パノラマのような景色
a panoramic view

content:
はは〔母〕
〈名〉A mother:(=の) maternal

content.content: 母が病気だ
Mother is ill.
生みの母
one's true mother
母の愛
maternal love
母の如き愛
motherly affection
あの先生は母のように生徒を愛する
She has a mather's affection for her pupils.
甘い母に育てられた
He was brought up by a fond mother.

content:
はば〔幅〕
〈名〉
1. Breadth; width

content.content: 幅はどれだけあるか
How broad is it?―How wide is it?―What is the width?―What is the breadth?
畳は長さ六尺幅三尺
A mat is six feet long and three feet wide―A mat measures six feet in length and three feet in width―A mat has a length of six feet and a width of three feet.
この船は長さ六フィート幅八十フィートある
The ship has a length of 600 feet and 80 feet beam.
幅が広い
It is wide―broad.
幅が狭い
It is narrow.
町の幅を広くする
to make the streets wider―make the streets broader―broaden the streets―widen the streets
一幅、二幅
one breadth―two breadths―of cloth
幅のある声
a full voice
幅が利く
to have influence (over others)
幅を利かす
to lay down the law
彼は町内で幅を利かしている
He lays down the law in the neighbourhood―He has influence over his neighbours―He is a person of influence in the neighbourhood―He is the cock of the walk.
あの学校の先生だと言えばこの辺ではちょっと幅が利く
A teacher of that school is somebody in the neighbourhood.
当節は役人は幅が利かない
Officials are now of no consequence―nobodies.
大臣もこうなると幅が利かない
A Cabinet-minister may find himself in a humiliating situation.
当節は風邪を引かないと幅が利かないようだ
Those who do not take cold nowadays dare not show their faces in public.

content:
ばば〔婆々〕
〈名〉
1. (=祖母)a grandmother; granny

content.content: 婆々育ちは三百下がる
A grandmother will spoil a child.

content: 2. (=老婆)an old woman

content.content: 鬼婆々
a hag―a termagant―a grimalkin

ばば〔馬場〕
〈名〉A riding-ground:(競馬のは)a race-course; the turf

content:
ははかた〔母方〕
〈名〉One's mother's side:(=の) maternal

content.content: 母方の親類
a maternal relation
あの人とは母方の親類だ
We are related on my mother's side―related on the maternal side―related on the distaff side―related on the spindle side.

はばかり〔憚り〕
〈名〉
1. (=憚ること)awe
2. (=便所)the water-closet (W. C.―と略す); the privy; the lavatory; the necessary:(米国にては)the toilet

content:
はばかりさま〔憚りさま〕
〈謝辞〉
1. Thank you; I am obliged to you; I am sorry to trouble you
2. 
〈転意〉

content.content: おはばかりさま、そんなドジな真似は致しません
Give me leave to say that I am not such a flat.

content:
はばかりながら〔乍憚〕
〈副〉
1. (=恐れ多いことだが)May I trouble you to...

content.content: はばかりながらその戸を締めて下さい
May I trouble you to―I'll trouble you to―I'll thank you to―shut the door.
はばかりながらその本を取って下さい
May I trouble you for―I'll trouble you for―I'll thank you for―that book.
はばかりながらその本を二三日貸して下さいませんか
Would you please lend me the book for a days?

content: 2. (=口広い言分だが)Give me leave to say...

content.content: はばかりながらそんなドジな真似は致しません
Give me leave to say that I am not such a flat.
はばかりながらそりゃ何かのお間違いでしょう
I beg your pardon, but you must be mistaken.
はばかりながら御説はちと事実と相違しております
With all respect for your opinion, your statement is not in strict accord with the truth.

content:
はばかる
〈自動〉To be rampant

content.content: 憎まれ子世にはばかる
Bad boys get on very well in the world―Weeds never die.

content:
はばかる〔憚る〕
〈他動〉To stand in awe of (a person); to be awed by (authority); to be deterred by (the law); to have deference to (the public opinion); to have regard for (others' feelings); shrink from (doing anything); to fear (nothing); to be afraid to (do anything); dare not (do anything)

content.content: 彼は誰の前をもはばからぬ
He is not awed by the presence of anybody.
裁判官の前をもはばからぬ
He is not awed by authority.
裁判官の前をはばからずにのろける
He boasts of his amours in the presence of authority.
僕は意見を述べるのに誰の前をもはばからぬ
I will give my opinion in anybody's presence―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Nobody can deter me from giving my opinion.
僕は誰の前をもはばからず直言する
I will speak my mind in anybody's face―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Nobody can deter me from speaking my mind.
事実を述べるのに何のはばかるところがあるか
What can deter me from speaking the truth?―Why should I fear to speak the truth?
世間をはばからず
in the face of the world
戦争成金は世間をはばからず勝手な真似をして暴状を極めた
The war-upstarts committed all sorts of excesses in the face of the world.
人は本分さえ尽しておけば、世間に対してはばかるところは無い
If a man will only do his duty, he is not afraid of the world―he can look the world in the face.
人の手前をはばかって思い止まった
I desisted out of regard for others' feelings―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Regard for others' feelings caused me to desist.
人は朝廷をはばかって言いたいことを言わずにいる
People do not speak the truth out of deference to the Court―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Deference to the court deters people from speaking the truth.
彼は世間をはばかって思うことをせずにいる
He refrains from carrying out his design out of deference to the public opinion―(他動詞構文)―Deference to the public opinion deters him from carrying out his design.
世間をはばかる
to defer to public opinion
世間をはばかること
conventional propriety―Grundyism (What will Mrs. Grundy say?―より出づ)
僕は知っているが言うをはばかる
I shrink from saying what I know.
なにもはばかるところは無いじゃないか
There is nothing to be afraid of―Why should you fear?
僕は言うをはばかるようなことはせぬ
I have done nothing I dare not own.
過ちを改むるにはばかるなかれ
Do not be afraid to amend your fault―(に相当するは)―“It is never too late to mend.”
彼は人前をはばかって思うことが言えぬ
He is afraid to speak what he thinks―He dare not say what he means.
人前をはばかる
to have a sense of decency―preserve one's decorum
人前をはばかって
for the sake of decency―from a sense of decency
人前をはばかって泣かずにいた
I refrained from tears from a sense of decency.
人前をはばからぬ
to have no sense of decency―forget one's decorum
人前をはばからず
in defiance of decorum―in the presence of company
西洋人は人前をはばからずいちゃつく
Foreigners make public demonstrations of affection in defiance of all decorum.
二人は人前をはばからずふざけ散らす
They carry on in the presence of company.
彼は人前をはばからず傍若無人の振舞をする
He will make himself at home in your face.
事他聞をはばかる
The matter asks secrecy―shuns publicity.
これは他聞をはばかることだが
Between ourselves,...
世をはばかる、人目をはばかる
to fly the face of man
神の御名をはばかって往々“goodness”を代用する
The word “goodness” is often substituted for “God” to avoid taking his name in vain.
はばかるところ無く言い給え
You may speak without reserve.
日本は天職を有する国なりと断言してはばからぬ
I may safely say―It is safe to say―that Japan has a mission.

はばき〔巾木〕
〈名〉(=壁の巾木)A skirting-board

はばき〔幅巾〕
〈名〉(A pair of) leggings

content:
はばきき〔幅利き〕
〈名〉A man of influence; a person of consequence

content.content: 彼は町内の幅利きだ
He has influence over his neighbours―He is a person of influence in the neighbourhood―He is the cock of the walk.

content:
はばたき〔羽叩き〕
〈名〉The flapping of wings:(一回なら)a flap:(=する) to flap the wings; to clap the wings:(蝶なら)to flutter

content.content: 雄鶏が羽叩きをして時をつくる
A cock flaps his wings and crows.

content:
はばったい〔幅ったい〕
〈形〉(A feeling) of something foreign having got between the parts

content.content: 何かはさまったように幅ったい
I feel as if something had got between the parts.

はばとび〔幅跳び〕
〈名〉A long jump

はばむ〔阻む〕
〈他動〉To cross, thwart, check, obstruct, prevent (one's design, etc.)

content:
はびこる〔蔓る〕
〈自動〉To spread; to sprawl; to gad; to run riot; to be rank; to be rampant

content.content: 雑草が庭いっぱいにはびこっている
Weeds run riot in the garden―Weeds overgrow the garden―The garden is overgrown with weeds.
草木が傍若無人にはびこる
Plants sprawl―Plants gad.
情慾がはびこる
The passions run riot.
奸臣はびこる
Intrigue is rampant.
あの家では女権がはびこっている
The women have everything their own way in that family.

content:
ばひつ〔馬匹〕
〈集名〉Horses; horseflesh

content.content: 馬匹を養成する
to breed horses
馬匹を改良する
to improve horses
馬匹を売買する
to deal in horseflesh
馬匹を鑑定する
He is a judge of horseflesh.
補充馬匹
remounts
馬匹を補充する
to supply remounts
馬匹共進会
a horse-show
馬匹団
a stud

ばひふう〔馬脾風〕
〈名〉Croup; diphtheria

content:
はふ〔破風〕
〈名〉The gable (of a house)

content.content: 破風造りの家
a gabled house

はぶ〔波布〕
〈名〉The venomous snake of the Loochoo Islands

content:
はぶく〔省く〕
〈他動〉To save (trouble or expenses); to omit (formalities); to leave out (unnecessary words); to exclude (Christians from office)

content.content: 手数を省くために
to save trouble
そうすれば手数が省ける
That will save (us) trouble.
今度の男は役に立つので僕はだいぶ手数が省ける
My new man is very useful, and saves me much trouble.
この本を使うと大いに教師の労を省く
The book saves the teacher much trouble.
余計な費用を省くようにせよ
You must be careful to save unnecessary expenses.
無用の手続きを省くことにしよう
We will omit useless formalities.
要らぬ言葉を省いて簡単にしよう
I will leave out unnecessary words for the sake of brevity.
これは雑費を省いての勘定か
Is the account exclusive of the expenses?
雑費を省いて三百円になる
It comes to 300 yen, exclusive of expenses.
彼も人選から省かれた仲間だ
He has been excluded from the selection.
冗費を省く
to cut down unnecessary expenses
冗語を省く
to prune redundancies

ばふさぎ〔場塞ぎ〕
〈名〉A stop-gap

はぶたえ〔羽二重〕
〈名〉Glossy silk

content:
はぶり〔羽振り〕
〈名〉
1. (=鳥の羽根の様子)plumage
2. (=勢力)social influence

content.content: 彼は羽ぶりが好い
He is influential.

content:
はぶり〔葉振り〕
〈名〉Foliage; leafage

content.content: 楓は葉ぶりが好い
The maple has a beautiful foliage.
楓は葉ぶりを賞す
The maple is prized for its foliage.
葉ぶりを賞する木を葉物と言う
Trees prized for their foliage are called foliage-trees.

ばふんし〔馬糞紙〕
〈名〉Strawboard; millboard

content:
はべる〔侍る〕
〈他動〉
1. to attend on, wait upon (one's lord)

content.content: 宴席に侍る女だ
These girls wait at banquets.
何々にて侍る、何々して侍る
I have the honour of being or doing...

はへん〔破片〕
〈名〉A fragment:(砲弾などの破片は)a splinter

はぼたん〔葉牡丹〕
〈名〉The cabbage (cultivated for the flower-pot)

はほん〔端本〕
〈名〉An odd volume; odd volumes

content:
はま〔浜〕
〈名〉
1. (=海浜)the beach; the strand; the seashore

content.content: 舟を浜に着ける
to beach a boat
死体が浜に打上げられる
A body is washed ashore.
難破船が浜に打上げられている
The wreck is stranded.
浜のいさごの様
numberless as the sands on the seashore
浜の真砂が尽きるとも
The countless sands may pass from off the seashore,
世に盗人の種は尽きまじ
And yet the thieves will have their day forever.

content: 2. (=漁村)a fishing-village

content.content: 鯨一匹捕れると七浜潤う
A single whale will enrich seven villages.

content:
はまき〔葉巻〕
〈名〉A cigar

content.content: 葉巻を吸う
to smoke a cigar
葉巻の匂いがする
I smell a cigar.
葉巻の匂いが好きだ
I like the smell of a cigar.
葉巻入れ
a cigar-case
葉巻パイプ
a cigar-holder
葉巻の吸殻
cigar-ends―old soldiers

content:
はまぐり〔蛤〕
〈名〉The clam

content.content: ハマグリ狩り
digging for clams

はまちどり〔浜千鳥〕
〈名〉The plover

はまやき〔浜焼〕
〈形〉(Fish) baked in a salt pan

content:
はまりこむ〔嵌まり込む〕
〈自動〉To fall into (some state); to plunge into (an affair)

content.content: ぬかるみにはまり込む
to stick in the mire
彼は一件に深くはまり込んでいる
He is far gone in the affair.
あの女にはまり込んでいる
He is stuck on the girl.
仕事にはまり込む
to take a good hold of one's work

はまりやく〔嵌まり役〕
〈名〉A well-fitting r?le:(役者なら)a part in character:(役人なら)an office in character

content:
はまる〔嵌まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=合う)to fit (a form); to fit into (a space); to get into (place or position)

content.content: 栓が穴にはまる
The peg fits into the hole.
彼は役にはまらない
He does not fit into his post―He is a square peg in a round hole.
上衣が身体のかっこうにキチンとはまる
The coat fits the figure to a nicety―fits the figure to a T.
引戸がはまらなくなった
The sliding door will not fit in―go in.
皆あるべきところにはまっている
Everything is in place―in position.
事務は型にはまっている
Business runs in a groove.
彼は型にはまった男だ
He is a methodical man.
彼は型にはまったような演説をする
He makes formalized speeches―stereotyped speeches.

content: 2. (=適する)to be fit for (the post); to be suited to (the place); to be adapted to (one's needs)

content.content: この地位にはまる人は少ない
Few men are exactly suited to the post―adapted to the post.
あの人ならこの地位によくはまる
He is the very man for the post―the right man in the right place.

content: 3. (=陥る)to fall into (a trap)

content.content: 敵の計略にはまる
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap―fall a victim to a stratagem
思う壺にはまる
to come in pat―hit it right
舞の足踏が壺にはまる
The dancer's steps fall pat to the music.

content:
はみがき〔歯磨〕
〈名〉Tooth-powder; dentifrice

content.content: 練歯磨
tooth-paste

はみがきようじ〔歯磨楊子〕
〈名〉A tooth-brush

はみだす〔喰み出す〕
〈自動〉To protrude; to bulge out

はみでる〔喰み出る〕
〈自動〉To protrude; to bulge out

content:
はむ〔食む〕
〈他動〉To eat (food); to live on (one's income)

content.content: 獣類相いはむ
Beasts devour one another.
骨肉を相いはむ
There is a strife among the same flesh and blood.
骨肉相はまず
“Dog does not eat dog.”
禄をはむ
to live on one's fief
千石の禄をはんだ
He had a fief of 1000 koku.
言を食む
to break one's word―go back on one's word

content:
はむかう〔歯向かう〕
〈他動〉To rise against, raise one's hand against (one's master, etc.)

content.content: 貴様は俺に歯向かう気か
Dare you raise your hand against me?―left a finger against me?
仁義に歯向かう剱無し
Virtue commands respect.

はむしゃ〔端武者〕
〈名〉The ranks; rank and file

content:
はめ〔羽目〕
〈名〉
1. (=壁の腰羽目)Wainscoting
2. (=窮境)a plight; a predicament; a situation

content.content: 苦しい羽目に陥った
I am placed in a delicate situation―in an embarrassing situation―in a fix―in a nice fix―in a tight box―in a cleft stick.
妙な羽目になった
I am in the wrong box.
のがれられない羽目になった
I am in for it.
かねての主義に反することをせねばならぬ羽目になった
I am placed in a false position.
仇敵の世話になる羽目になった
I was obliged to receive help from enemy.
羽目をはずす
to abandon oneself to pleasure
羽目をはずして騒ぐ
to go on the spree―paint the sky red―have a gay frolic―have a boisterous merry-making
羽目をはずして騒いでいる
They are on the spree―painting the town red.

はめいた〔羽目板〕
〈名〉A wainscot:(集合的に言えば)wainscoting

content:
はめこむ〔嵌め込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=差し込む)to fit (anything into a place)

content.content: 不適任者をはめ込む
to foist an unfit person into a post

content: 2. (=陥れる)to ensnare; to entrap

content.content: 敵を計略にはめ込む
to entrap the enemy―ensnare the enemy
彼は始終僕をはめ込もうとしている
He is always setting traps for me―laying snares for me.

content:
はめつ〔破滅〕
〈名〉Ruin; wreck:(=する) to be ruined; to go to ruin; to go to wreck; to go to rack and ruin; to go to the devil; to go to the dogs

content.content: 今度成功しなけりゃ破滅だ
I must succeed this time, or I am ruined―done for.
彼は商売で失敗して破滅した
He failed in business, and went to wreck―went under―went up.
惚れられたのが身の破滅
He was beloved to his ruin.
身の破滅を招く
to bring down ruin on oneself―ruin oneself

content:
はめる〔嵌める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=差し込む)to fit (anything into its position); to get (anything) into place; to get (anything) into position; to set (a diamond in a ring―a ring with a diamond)

content.content: 引戸をはめる
to a get sliding door into position
窓にガラスをはめる
to fit a window with glass―glaze a window
指環に宝石をはめる
to set a gem in a ring―set a ring with a gem
指環をはめる
to put on a ring
この指環をはめてご覧
Try on this ring!
彼はダイヤの指環をはめている
He wears a diamond ring.
手袋をはめる
to draw on one's gloves―pull on one's gloves―glove one's hands
彼は人を同じ型にはめようとする
He would stretch all men on the bed of Procrustes―make all men uniform.

content: 2. (=投げ込む)to throw in

content.content: 僕を河へはめた
He threw me into the river.

content: 3. (=陥れる)to ensnare; to entrap

content.content: 敵を計略にはめる
to ensnare the enemy―entrap the enemy
彼は始終僕をはめようとしている
He is always setting traps for me―laying snares for me.

はめん〔波面〕
〈名〉［物理］The wave-front

content:
ばめん〔場面〕
〈名〉
1. (=場所)room; space; ground

content.content: 場面が広い
There is plenty of room.
場面が狭い
We are pinched for room―cramped for space.
場面をふさぐ
to take up room―occupy much space―cover much ground

content: 2. (=芝居、活動写真などの場面)a scene

content.content: 場面一変す
The scene changes―The scene shifts.
場面が賑かになる
The scene becomes lively―The scene is enlivened.
場面沸騰
The whole scene is in a ferment.
(小説の)場面は満洲になっている
The scene is laid in Manchuria.

はも〔鱧〕
〈名〉A kind of sea-eel

content:
はもの〔刃物〕
〈名〉An edged tool; an edge-tool:(総称すれば)cutlery

content.content: 鋭利な刃物
a sharp tool
狂人に刃物
(Do not place) an edge-tool in the hands of a madman.
刃物三昧
bloodshed―attempt to shed blood
刃物師
a cutler

content:
はもの〔端物〕
〈名〉An odd set; a broken set; an incomplete set

content.content: 端物にする
to break the set
一つ離して売ると後は端物になります
If I part with one of the number, I shall break the set.

content:
はもの〔葉物〕
〈名〉A foliage-tree

content.content: 葉ぶりを賞する木を葉物と言う
A tree prized for its foliage is called a foliage-tree.

content:
はものざんまい〔刃物三昧〕
〈名〉Bloodshed; attempt to shed blood

content.content: あの男は刃物三昧に及ぶから油断がならぬ
You must be on your guard against him, for he is apt to use a knife.

content:
はもん〔波紋〕
〈名〉Ripples

content.content: 絹に波紋をつける
to water silk
波紋ある絹
watered silk

content:
はもん〔破門〕
〈名〉(宗教にては)excommunication:(一般には)ban; taboo; expulsion:(=する) to excommunicate (a heretic); to taboo (a culprit); to place (a questionable character) under the ban; to send (one) to Coventry; to expel (an irregular student)

content.content: 彼は師匠から破門された
He was expelled by his master.
彼は例の事件以来やかましい人達から破門されている
Since his last scandal, he has lost caste with precise people.

content:
はや〔早や〕
〈副〉Already; so soon

content.content: 早や十二時だ
It is twelve already.
早やお帰りか
Are you going so soon?
来て見れば早や遅かりし
I found that I was too late.
彼に叫んで危険の警戒したが早や遅かった
I shouted to him to warn him of the danger, but it was too late.
早や遅蒔きの唐辛子
It is now too late―a day after the fair.

content:
はやあし〔早足〕
〈名〉A quick pace:(軍隊の早足は)quick march:(馬の早足は)trot

content.content: 早足に歩く
to walk at a quick pace―at a smart pace―at a brisk pace
馬が早足で馬車を引く
A horse draws a carriage at a trot―A carriage-horse trots.

content:
はやい〔早い〕
〈形〉
1. (=速力の早い)fast (ship or train); rapid (progress); swift (motion); speedy (horse); fleet (steed); quick, brisk smart (pace)

content.content: あの人は足が早い
He is fleet of foot―swift of foot―swift-footed.
君は足が早くて僕はついて行けない
You walk so fast that I can't keep up with you.
口が早い
He speaks fast―He is a fast speaker.
先生は口が早くて聞き取れない
He speaks so fast that I can not follow him.
早い馬だ
It is a swift horse―a fleet steed―a speedy horse.
犬には足の早いのと鼻の利くのとある
Some dogs are chosen for speed, others for scent.
この船は船脚が早い
This ship sails fast―She is a fast sailer.
流れが早い
The stream is rapid―The current is swift.
雲脚が早い
The clouds are driving across the sky.
彼は進歩が早い
He makes rapid progress.
月日のたつのは早いものだ
Time flies.

content: 2. (=動作の早い)quick (eye or ear); rapid (growth); ready (wit); prompt (answer); speedy (reply); sharp (work)

content.content: 君は目が早い
You have a quick eye―You are sharp-sighted.
子どもは耳が早い
Children are quick-eared―quick of hearing―“Little pitchers have long ears.”
彼は頓智が早い
He has a ready wit―He is quick-witted―sharp-witted.
日本人は合点が早い
The Japanese are quick of apprehension.
江戸子は気が早い
Tokyo people are quick-tempered―short-tempered―excitable.
江戸子はけんかが早い
The Edokko is quick to quarrel.
あの人は計算が早い
He is quick at accounts―ready at figures.
即答が早い
He is quick at repartee―ready at repartee.
仕事が早い
He is quick with his work―a quick hand―a fast worker.
実に手早い
Sharp work!
この木は生長が早い
This tree grows rapidly.
江戸は火事早い
Tokyo is subject to frequent fires.
火移りが早い
It easily catches fire.
早い話が近道をして邪道に入ったのだ
To make a long story short, he tried to get money without working for it.

content: 3. (=時の早い)early (season); premature (death)

content.content: 寝るにはまだ早い
It is too early to go to bed.
まだ早いからもっと話して行き給え
Say a little longer, it is still early.
麦藁帽子をかぶるにはまだ早い
It is too early for straw hats.
お嫁に行くにはまだ早い
She is too young to marry.
シベリア経由はバンクーバー経由より四日だけ早い
The Siberian route is shorter than the route via Vancourver by four days.
まだ一時間早い
It is an hour too early―an hour too soon.
早いほどが好い
The sooner, the better.

Do you get up early?―Are you an early riser?
手前どもでは早寝早起きです
We keep early hours―keep good hours.
早起き三文の得
“The early bird catches the worm.”

content:

content.content: 早桶に片足突込んでいる
He has one foot in the grave.

He said he had business with me, and I jumped to the conclusion that he wanted to borrow money.

content:
はやがね〔早鐘〕

content.content: 早鐘を打つ
to ring the fire-bell―sound the fice-alarm
胸は早鐘を打つよう
My heart beat fast.

はやがわり〔早変り〕
〈名〉(An actor's) quick-change:(=する) to make a quick change of. parts; to change parts instantaneously

content:
はやく〔早く〕
〈副〉
1. (=速力の早く)fast; rapidly; swiftly

content.content: この船は早く走る
The ship sails fast―She is a fast sailer.
雑草は早く生長する
Weeds grow rapidly.
この鳥は早く飛ぶ
This bird flies swiftly.

content: 2. (=動作の早く)quickly; rapidly; promptly; with promptly; with despatch

content.content: 早く早く
Be quick (about it)!―Use despatch!―Look alive!―Look sharp!
お客さんにお早く願いますと言え
Tell the gentleman to look alive!
グズグズしないで早く来い
Look sharp!―Sharp's the word!
こういう病気は早く手当をしないと手後れになる
Such cases require prompt attention.
どうせやるなら早くやれ
If you give at all, give quickly.
早く覚える者は早く忘れる
Those who learn quickly, forget as quickly.
早く返事しろ
Answer promptly―Answer with promptitude.

content: 3. (=時の早く)early; soon; betimes［注意］「朝早く」「時期早く」「時代早く」には“early”を用いる、例えば

content.content: 朝早くたった
I started early in the morning―at an early hour―bright and early―I made an early start.
彼は朝早く出て晩遅く帰る
He goes out early in the morning, and comes home late in evening.
朝早くから夜遅くまで働く
He works early and late―from early till late.
君は早く起きるか
Do you get up early?―Are you an early riser?
早く起きて一番汽車に間に合った
I got up so early as to be in time for the first train.
一番に間に合うように早く起きた
I got up early, so as to be in time for the first train.
朝早く起きて天気模様を見た
I was up betimes to mark the signs of the weather.
昨晩は早く寝た
I went to bed early last night.
手前どもでは早く寝て早く起きます
We keep early hours―keep good hours.
彼は早く両親に死に別れた
He early lost his parents―He lost his parents at an early age.
この果物は早く熟する
This fruit ripens early.
日本は早くから支那と貿易した
Japan early traded with China―Japan's trade with China began in an early age.
早くお返事を願います
Please oblige me with an early answer―a speedy answer.
ご都合でなるべく早く金をお返し下さい
Please pay the money at your earliest convenience.［注意］「ほど無く」「じきに」の意味には“soon”を用いる。例えば
なるべく早く来い
Come as soon as possible―as soon as you can.
早く来るほどが好い
The sooner, the better.
早く運びをつけてもらいたい
I want the matter settled as soon as possible.
何故もっと早く来なかったか
Why did you not come sooner?―earlier?
どちらが早く着くだろうか
Which do you think will arrive sooner?
医者がもっと早く来たらけが人は助かったのだに
If the doctor had come sooner―earlier―the injured would have been saved.
事件が早くかたづけばよい
I with the matter would soon be over―come to a speedy conclusion.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 早くお帰りよ
(Come back soon―と言わずして) Don't be long!
早く帰る
I shall not be long.
一刻も早く、片時も早く
There is no time to lose―There is not a moment to be lost.
一刻も早く病人の手当をしろ
You must lose no time in attending to the sick.
早くその時になれば好い
How I long for that time to come!
早く故郷へ帰りたい
How I long to see my native land!
早く試験の成績が聞きたい
I am anxious to know the result of my examination.
彼は早く行きたがってバタバタしている
He is impatient to be gone.
子どもらが早くお祭りへ行きたがっている
The children are eager to go to the festival.
早く大きくなって偉くおなりなさい
Make haste and grow up to be a great man!

〈自動〉To be rash; to be hasty

content.content: 早まったことをする
to do anything rash―commit a rash act―go off at half-cock―be carried away by a sudden impulse
彼はいったいどうしてこんな早まったことをしたのかしら
I wonder why he has committed such a rash act.
君は何という早まったことをしてくれた
What a rash thing you have done!
若い者はとかく早まったことをしたがる

若い者は往々早まって失敗する

早まったことをするな

後生だからどうぞ早まったことをして下さるな
For Heaven's sake, don't suffer yourself to be carried away by any sudden impulse!

those in the swim―those in the know―the knowing one's―the knowing set―the insiders

content: 〈形〉(To be) quick-eared, quick of hearing

〈他動〉To quicken (one's pace); to hasten (an event); to accelerate (motion); to put on (speed); to expedite (matters); to move up (hours)

content.content: 雨模様がしてきたから足を早めた
Signs of rain made me quicken my pace―mend my pace.
足を早めて歩く
to walk at a quick pace―at a brisk pace―at a smart pace
商売で失敗したのが彼の死期を早めた
Failure in business hastened his death.
商業界の不景気が彼の破滅を早めた

敵艦は速力を早めて追って来た

君が来たので事を早めた
Your arrival has expedited matters.
明日から時間を早めます
We shall move up the hours from tomorrow.

content:
はやり〔流行〕
〈名〉Fashion; vogue; favour; popularity; prevalence (of a disease):(=の) fashionable (dress); stylish (coat); popular (song); prevailing (style); prevalent (notion, etc.)

content.content: 今のはやりだ
It is now in fashion―quite the thing.
今のはやりの柄
the pattern in fashion
これが今のはやりの新形です
This is the latest fashion.
今のはやりの観光団
the tourist-parties now in vogue
今のはやりの飛行機
the aeroplane now in favour (with the public)
腕時計が今のはやりだ
Wrist-watches are now in fashion―It is the fashion now to wear wrist-watches.
自動車は大はやりだ
Motoring is all the mode―all the rage―all the go―quite the go―the craze of the day―There is a craze for motoring.
はやりに乗る
to follow the fashion―bow the knee to Baal
はやりは廃れる
Fashions go out.
はやりだとて妙なことをするものだ
Strange things are done in the name of fashion.

はやりうた〔流行唄〕
〈名〉A popular song

はやりお〔逸り雄〕
〈名〉A hot head:(単数集合名詞で言うと)young blood

はやりかぜ〔流行性感冒〕
〈名〉Influenza

content:

〈名〉A deity in vogue; a popular god

〈名〉A catchword; a catch-phrase

content:

〈名〉A person much sought after; a lion

content.content: あの先生は流行児だ
He is much sought after.
文壇の流行児だ
He is a lion of the literary world―a literary lion.
花柳界の流行児だ
She is much run after in the frivolous community.

はやりめ〔流行眼病〕
〈名〉Epidemic ophthalmia

はやりやまい〔流行病〕
〈名〉An epidemic

content:
はやる〔早る、逸る〕
〈自動〉To be carried away

content.content: 血気にはやる
to be carried away by the ardour of youth
血気にはやって満洲へ飛び出した
Ardour of youth carried him to Manchuria.
血気にはやる若者
a hot-blooded youth―a hot-headed youth―a hot head―(単数集合名詞にて言えば)―young blood
短気にはやる
to be carried away by a sudden impulse
後生だから短気にはやって下さるな
For Heaven's sake, do not suffer yourself to be carried away by any sudden impulse.
感情にはやる
to be carried away by feeling
気ははやれども足は進まず
“The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
はやる心を抑える
to check one's impetuosity

content:
はやる〔早る、逸る〕
〈自動〉To be carried away

content.content: 血気にはやる
to be carried away by the ardour of youth
血気にはやって満洲へ飛び出した
Ardour of youth carried him to Manchuria.
血気にはやる若者
a hot-blooded youth―a hot-headed youth―a hot head―(単数集合名詞にて言えば)―young blood
短気にはやる
to be carried away by a sudden impulse
後生だから短気にはやって下さるな
For Heaven's sake, do not suffer yourself to be carried away by any sudden impulse.
感情にはやる
to be carried away by feeling
気ははやれども足は進まず
“The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
はやる心を抑える
to check one's impetuosity

content:
はやる〔流行る〕
〈自動〉
1. (嗜好品なら)to be in fashion:(習慣なら)to be in vogue:(遊びなどなら)to be in favour (with the public):(教科書などなら)to be in use:(唄などなら)to be popular:(病気なら)to prevail; to be prevalent:(店なら)to prosper; to flourish; to have a large custom:(医者や弁護士なら)to have a large practice:(形容詞に用いれば)fashionable (hat); popular (song); prevalent (disease); flourishing (shop, etc.)

content.content: はやらぬ
to be out of fashion―out of vogue―out of favour―out of use
腕時計がはやる
Wrist-watches are in fashion―It is the fashion to wear wrist-watches―It is fashionable to wear wrist-watches.
今年はどんな帽子がはやるか
What sort of hats are in fashion this year?―What sort of hats are wearing this year?―What is this year's fashion for hats?―What is this year's style for hats?
そんな帽子ははやらぬ
That kind of hats are out of fashion.
もうはやらぬ
They are no longer in fashion―no longer the fashion.
一時ははやったが廃れた
They were in fashion for a time, but they have gone out―They have had their day.
西洋では柔術がはやっている
Jujutsu is in vogue in foreign countries.
どんな遊びが今学生間にはやっているか
What game is now in favour with the students?―What is the popular game among students?
この唄は一時ははやったものだ
This song was popular once.
この教科書は今はやらない
This book is out of use―in disuse.
自動車がたいそうはやる
Motoring is all the mode―all the rage―all the go―quite the go―the craze of the day―There is a craze for motoring.
いま東京で腸チフスがはやっている
Typhoid fever prevails―Typhoid fever is prevalent―in Tokyo.
あの店は愛想が好いからはやる
That shop has a large custom, because they are courteous to people.
あれははやる店だ
It is a flourishing shop.
あの医者はたいそうはやっている
The doctor has an extensive practice.
はやってくる、はやりだす
to come into fashion―come into vogue―come into favour―come into use
妙な頭がはやってきた
A curious style of head-dress has come into fashion.
飛行機が段々はやってくる
Flying is coming into vogue―growing in popular favour―growing in popularity.
コレラがはやりだした
Cholera has broken out.
はやらなくなる
to go out of fashion―go out of vogue―go out of favour―go out of use―fall into disuse―fall into disfavour
太いズボンははやらなくなった
Wide trousers have gone out of fashion.
自転車ははやらなくなった
Bicycling has gone out of vogue―gone out of favour―fallen into disfavour.
この教科書ははやらなくなった
This book has gone out of use―fallen into disuse.
はやらせる
to set the fashion―set a new style in fashion―bring a new game into favour―popularize a game―make a shop flourish

content:
はやわかり〔早解かり〕
〈形〉
1. (=わかりやすい)(to be) easy to understand

content.content: その方が早わかりで好い
People will understand that better.

content: 2. (=合点が早い)(to be) quick of apprehension

はやわざ〔早業〕
〈名〉
1. A feat of agility

content.content: 目にも止まらぬ(電光石火の如き)早業であった
It was done with lightning speed.
手練の早業
a feat of agility―a feat of dexterity
なかなかの早業だ
Sharp work!

content: 2. (=手品の早業)a sleight of hand; a legerdemain

はら〔腹〕
〈名〉
1. (=腹部)the belly; the paunch; the abdomen:(=の) abdominal

content.content: 腹が痛む
to have a colic―have a stomach-ache
腹が痛い
I have a colic―I am suffering from colic.
彼がいくら金を使ったって君の腹が痛む訳じゃあるまい
His extravagance can not concern your pocket.
痛くない腹を探られる
to be falsely accused―placed in a false position
腹を肥やす
to fill one's pocket―line one's purse―feather one's nest
腹を切る
to disembowel oneself
悪かったら腹を切る
I will answer for my crime.
間違ったら腹を切る
I will answer for my mistake with my life.
腹を抱えて笑う
to hold one's sides with laughter
腹の皮をよじる
to split one's sides with laughter―be convulsed with laughter―be thrown into convulsions
(あの人はあまりばかなことを言うから)腹の皮をよじることがある
He something throws us into convulsions.
背に腹は替えられぬ
“Close sits my shirt, but closer sits my skin”―“Needs must when the devil drives.”
便々たる太鼓腹
a pot-belly―a corporation
親指の腹
the ball of the thumb

content: 2. (=食物の入る腹)the stomach; the belly; one's inner man

content.content: 腹が空く
to become hungry―feel hungry
腹がへった
I am hungry.
腹がへってきた、腹がへってたまらない
Hunger begins to make itself felt.
腹がへっては軍ができぬ
One can not fight on an empty stomach―“An army fights on its belly.”
腹をへらすと何でもうまい
“Hunger is the best sauce.”
空き腹
an empty stomach
空き腹に飲む
to drink on an empty stomach
腹をふさぐ
to satisfy one's appetite
兵は生ま米を噛って腹をふさいだ
The men satisfied their appetite on raw rice.
芋でも食って腹をふさごう
I will satisfy my appetite on potatoes.
腹がふさがる、腹の足しになる
to fill (the stomach)
日本料理は腹がふさがらないと西洋人が言う
Foreigners say that Japanese food does not fill.
腹をこしらえる
to eat―fill one's stomach―refresh one's inner man
腹をこしらえて取りかかろう
I will set about my task after eating―with a full stomach.
腹いっぱい食う、腹いっぱい飲む
to eat one's fill―drink one's fill
腹がいっぱいだ
I am full.
腹が苦しい
I am as tight as a drum.
いっぱい食って腹をふくらす
to fill one's stomach―line one's stomach―line one's jacket
腹鼓を打つ
to have a full stomach
腹が張った
(いっぱい食ってなら)I have a full stomach―(ガスが溜ってなら)―I am full of wind.
腹が張って動けない
My stomach is so full that I can not move.
芋を食うと腹が張る
Potatoes are flatulent.
味噌汁は腹に持つ、腹にこたえる
Bean-soup stays the stomach―It has a sustaining power.
茶腹も一時
A cup of tea will stay the stomach for a while.
腹の虫がまだ承知しない
My inner man is not yet satisfied.
(好きな専門などを選ぶと)腹の虫が承知する
Every fibre of your being consents to it.
(気に入らない専門を選ぶと)腹の虫が承知しない
Every fibre of your being protests against it.
腹の虫を殺す
to repress one's inclinations
腹をこなす
to digest one's dinner
腹ごなしに歩こう
Let us take a walk to digest our dinners―to aid digestion.
ある食物が腹に合う、腹に合わぬ
Some food agrees with one―disagrees with one.
口には合うが腹に合わぬ
I like it, but it does not like me.
腹時計はもう十二時だ
My stomach tells me that it is dinner-time.
腹八分は医者いらず
Moderate eating keeps the doctor away―Temperance is better than medicine.
腹も身の内
Be careful what you put into your belly.

content: 3. (=腹工合の腹)the bowels

content.content: 腹が下る
to have loose bowels―have diarrhoea
腹を下した
I have loose bowels―I am suffering from diarrhoea.
(食い過ぎた)腹を悪くした、腹をこわした
I have got my bowels out of order by overeating myself.
僕の腹は狂いやすくて困る
My bowels easily get out of order.
腹がゆるむ
to have loose bowels
腹をゆるめる
to loosen one's bowels
味噌汁は腹薬だ
Bean-soup is good for the bowels.
腹が鳴る
I have a rumbling in my bowels.

content: 4. (=孕む腹)the womb

content.content: 子が腹に宿る
A child enters the womb.
腹の子
the child in the womb―an unborn child―a foetus―an embryo
母は罪人でも腹の子には罪がない
The mother may be a criminal, but the child in her womb is innocent.
腹の子の始末はどうして下さる
What are your intentions with regard to her unborn child?
腹が脹れる
A woman becomes pregnant―goes with child.
腹が大きい、大きな腹をしている
She is pregnant―with child―in the family way―in an interesting condition.
妾の腹にできた子がある
He has a child by his concubine.
腹が違う
They are by different mothers―half-brothers―half-sisters.
腹を痛めた子
a child of one's own bearing
自分の腹を痛めた子でないから遠慮している
She keeps her distance towards him, for he is not a child of her own bearing.
腹は借り物
The mother does not count in a pedigree.

content: 5. (=心底)the heart; the mind; intention

content.content: 君には僕の腹がわかるまい
You do not know my mind.
腹の中は至って好い男だ
He is, at heart,―at bottom,―a good fellow.
腹の中ではそう思っていまい
He does not think so in his heart of hearts.
腹の中で笑っているだろう
He must be laughing in his sleeves.
彼は腹ができている
He has a cultured mind.
腹ができていない
His mind is uncultured.
これを金儲けの種にする腹らしい
It seems to be his intention to make capital out of it.
腹が大きい
He has a large mind―a great heart―He is generous―magnanimous.
腹が黒い
He has a black heart―an evil heart―He is black-hearted―evil-hearted.
腹が汚い
He has a mean mind―a base heart.
腹を決める
to make up one's mind
このことについては腹を決めている
My mind is made up on the subject.
あの人は口と腹が違う
He says one thing and means another―He does not mean what he says.
腹が立つ
I am angry―displeased―offended―vexed.
見ると腹が立つ
The sight makes me angry.
あの男には腹が立つ
I am angry with him―I have no patience with him―I am out of patience with him.
今日は腹の立つことばかりある日だ
Everything goes wrong with me today.
腹を立てる
to get angry―take offence―lose one's temper―get out of temper
彼は些細なことで腹を立てる
He will take offence at trifles.
腹をいやす
to glut one's ire―wreak one's grudge―revenge oneself
彼と腹が合う
We are of the same mind―of a mind.
腹を合わせる
to conspire with―collude with―some one
二人は腹を合わして僕をだました
They conspired together to cheat me.
会計と腹を合わして金を儲けた
He made money in collusion with the treasurer.
二人は腹を合わしている
They are in league with each other―They have a secret understanding with each other―There is a secret understanding between them.
彼らは皆腹を合わしている
They are all conspirators―confederates―accomplices.
腹に一物ある
He has some end in view―an axe to grind.
腹をすえている
My mind is make up―I am prepared for the worst.
あの男は腹にすえかねる
I am angry with him―I have no patience with him.
彼の仕打は腹にすえかねる
I am angry at his conduct.

content:
はらう〔払う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=支払う)to pay (money); to settle (a bill); to meet (One's bills)

content.content: 金を払う
to pay the money
品物の代を払う
to pay for an article
この洋服はまだ代が払ってない
This coat is not yet paid for.
前金を払う
to pay in advance―advance money
勘定を払う
to pay the bill―foot the bill―settle the bill―discharge the bill―settle one's account―meet one's bills―settle one's score―pay one's reckoning
誰が勘定を払うか
Who will pay the piper?―bear the expenses?
君に勘定を払わなければならぬ
I must settle accounts with you―settle with you―reckon with you.
借金を払う
to pay a debt
借金を綺麗に払ってしまった
I have paid off my debts―cleared off my debts.
この金があれば借金が綺麗に払える
This money will free me from my debts.
この金は借金を払う足しになる
This money will go towards the debts.
家賃を払う
to pay the rent
この家はいくら家賃を払う
What do you pay for your house?
家賃を百円払う
I pay 100 yen for my house.
木戸銭を払う
to pay the admission fee
木戸銭を払って入る
to pay one's way in
払うべき金額
the amount payable―the amount due
手形は来月払わなければならぬ
The bill is due next month.
払うべき金を払って世を渡る
to pay one's way through the world

content: 2. (=掃除する)to clear; to brush; to sweep

content.content: 塵を払う
to brush away the dust
吹いて塵を払う

着物を振って塵を払う
to shake off the dust
ブラシで洋服の塵を払う

爪で着物の塵を払う
to fillip the dust from one's clothes
はたきで座敷の塵を払う
to dust the room
道具の塵を払う
to dust the furniture
(再び足踏みをせぬ決心で)足の塵を払って去る
to shake the dust off one's feet
雨が降って空中の塵を払う
The rain clears the air from dust.
風が雲を吹き払う
The wind clears the sky from clouds.
お髯の塵を払う
to pay court to―curry favour with―dance attendance on―fawn upon―a great personage
露を払う
to brush off the dewdrops―shake off the dewdrops
草の露を払う
to brush the dewdrops off the grass
風が平原を払う
The wind sweeps the plain.
(速射砲で)敵艦の甲板を払う
to sweep the enemy's deck
蠅を払う
to drive away the flies
馬が尾を振って蠅を払う
A horse whisks the flies away.
頤で蠅を払う

日が出て霧を払う
The sun dispels the mist.
驟雨炎熱を払う

陣営を払う
to strike camp―strike the tents
支柱を払う
to knock off the supports

to unsheathe a sword―draw the sword
悪魔を払う

追い払う

木を切り払う
to clear away the trees―clear the land from trees
木の枝を払う
to lop the branches of a tree
人を払う
to clear the room of people
都会を焼き払う

気が張る
One's mind is stretched―One's nerves are strained―One's senses are strained.
気が張っている
My mind is on the stretch―My nerves are on the strain.
忙しいと気が張っている
Press of business keeps one's mind on the stretch―keeps one's nevers on the strain―keeps one's senses on the strain.
値が張る
The price is high―The price comes high.
お値段は少々張りますがこちらはズッとお品が好くなります
The price is a little higher, but the quality is far superior.
この品は値段が張って僕には買えぬ
The article is too expensive for me.
入費が張る
The expenses are heavy.
仕事が張る、張り過ぎる
The work is heavy―The work is too heavy for me.
荷が張る、この車には張り過ぎる
The load is heavy―The load is too heavy for the cart.

content:
はる〔貼る〕
〈他動〉To stick (a bill on the wall); to paste (a box with paper); to paste up, put up (a bill); to post (a bill); to put (a stamp on a letter); to affix (a stamp to a bond); to apply (a plaster to a sore)

content.content: 貼札を貼る
to stick a bill on the wall―paste up a bill―put up a bill―post a bill―placard the walls
壁に貼札がベタベタ貼ってある
The walls are covered all over with bills and posters.
壁に紙を貼る
to paste the wall with paper―paper the wall
壁に紙が貼ってある
The walls are papered.
手紙に切手を貼る
to stick a stamp on a letter―put a stamp on a letter
この手紙に切手が貼ってない
There is no stamp on the letter.
この手紙にいくらの切手を貼るんですか
What is the postage for this letter?
三銭の切手を貼ればよろしい
Put a three-sen stamp on it.
領収書に印紙を貼る
to affix a stamp to a receipt
膏薬を貼る
to stick a plaster―apply a plaster―plaster a sore
顔にベタベタと膏薬を貼っている
His face is plastered all over.
障子を貼る
to paper the screens
提灯を貼る
to make paper-lanterns
唐傘を貼る
to make paper-umbrellas

content:
はるか〔遙か〕
〈副〉Far

content.content: はるか遠方に灯火が見えた
I saw a light far in the distance―far away.
はるか東の方に島がある
There is an island far to the eastward.

content:
はるがすみ〔春霞〕
〈名〉Spring haze

content.content: 春霞が立つ
There is spring haze.

はるかぜ〔春風〕
〈名〉The spring breeze

content:
はるかに〔遙かに〕
〈副〉Far; by far; by a long way; by long odds; by all odds; far and away; out and away; out of sight

content.content: はるかに富士をのぞむ
We see Mt. Fuji far away―far in the distance.
この方がはるかに好い
This is far better than that―better than the other by far―by far the better of the two.
彼の学問ははるかに人より勝れている
He is by far the best scholar―far and away the best scholar―out of sight the best scholar.

はるぎ〔春着〕
〈名〉Spring wear; the New Year's clothes

はるげしき〔春景色〕
〈名〉Spring scenery

はるこ〔春蚕〕
〈名〉The spring silkworm

content:
はるご〔春蚕〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: はるこ〔春蚕〕

はるごころ〔春心〕
〈名〉Sexual passion; sexual desire

はるごま〔春駒〕
〈名〉A stallion on heat

はるさめ〔春雨〕
〈名〉The spring rain; a vernal shower

content:
はるばる〔遙々〕
〈副〉From afar; all the way

content.content: はるばる来ました
I have come from afar―I have come a great distance.
はるばる来た友だ
He is a friend come from afar.
はるばる北海道から会いに来たのだ
I came all the way from Hokkaido to see you.
はるばるおいでになったのに不在でお気の毒です
I am sorry you find him absent after coming all this way.

content:
はるめく〔春めく〕
〈自動〉To look like spring; to show signs of coming spring

content.content: だいぶ春めいて来ました
Nature is putting on her spring livery.
酒飲めば何時か
“Wine maketh glad the heart of man,”
心も春めきて
And makes of winter genial spring;
借金取りも
And e'en the bill-collecting dun
鶯の声
Doth to me like a robin sing.

content:
はれ〔腫れ〕
〈名〉Swelling

content.content: 腫れが引く
The swelling goes down.

content:
はれ〔晴れ〕
〈名〉Clear weather; fair weather; fine weather

content.content: ［天気予報］西の風、晴れ
West wind; fair.

content: 〈形〉Public (place); grand (occasion); best (clothes)

content.content: 晴れの場所
a public place
晴れの場所でひきょうは働けぬ
One can not act the coward before a cloud of witnesses.
晴れの舞台
a grand occasion
晴れの舞台の働きぶりは立派なものであった
His behaviour was splendid on the grand occasion.
晴れの着物
one's best―one's Sunday clothes―one's Sunday best―gala-dress
今日を晴れと着飾っている
They are in their best―dressed out in their best.

はれあがる〔腫れ上がる〕
〈自動〉To swell up

content:
ばれい〔馬齢〕
〈名〉A horse's age:(より)my age

content.content: 馬齢を加える
to grow older by one year
幸に馬齢を加え候間御休神被下度候{さいわいにばれいをくわえそうろうあいだごきゅうしんくだされたくそうろう}
It must be great news to you to hear that the New Year finds me one year older.

ばれいしょ〔馬鈴薯〕
〈名〉The (common) potato

はれがましい〔晴がましい〕
〈形〉Public; open; showy; ostentatious

content:
はれぎ〔晴着〕
〈名〉One's best (clothes); one's Sunday clothes; one's Sunday best; gala-dress

content.content: 皆、晴れ着を着ている
They are in their best.

content:
はれつ〔破裂〕
〈名〉Bursting (of a boiler); outburst (of passion); explosion (of a shell); eruption (of a volcano); rupture (of negotiations):(=する) to burst; to explode; to erupt; to be broken off; to go bang

content.content: 汽缶が破裂する
A boiler bursts.
水道の鉄管が破裂した
The water-pipe has burst.
爆弾が破裂する
A bomb explodes.
榴弾が破裂しなかった
The shell did not explode.
地雷火が破裂した
The mine went bang.
火山が破裂している
The volcano is in eruption.
心臓破裂
rupture of the heart
談判が破裂した
The negotiations are broken off.
談判破裂
rupture of negotiations

はれつだん〔破裂弾〕
〈名〉A shell; a bomb

content:
ぱれっと〔パレッと〕
〈副〉Clear

content.content: 天気がパレッと晴れる
The weather clears up.

content:
ぱれっと〔パレッと〕
〈副〉Clear

content.content: 天気がパレッと晴れる
The weather clears up.

content:
はれて〔晴れて〕
〈副〉Publicly; openly

content.content: 晴れて夫婦になる
to become man and wife in the face of the world
天下晴れての夫婦だ
We are man and wife in the sight of Heaven.
天下晴れての女房です、天下晴れての亭主があります
I am a lawful wife―a wedded wife―an honest woman.
天下晴れての女房にしろ
You must make and honest woman of her.
天下晴れての女房になった
I am made an honest woman of.
天下晴れて歩ける身になった
I am no longer under a cloud.

content:
はればれ〔晴々〕
〈形〉Bright and clear:(=する) to be bright and clear

content.content: 雨上りは晴々する
It is bright and clear after a rain.
晴々した天気だ
It is clear weather.
晴々した顔をしている
He has a bright face―a cheerful countenance.
気が晴々する
to fell cheerful―feel light-hearted

content:
はれぼったい〔腫れぼったい〕
〈形〉Swollen

content.content: あまり泣いて腫れぼったい目をしている
She has swollen eyes―eyes swollen with crying.

content:
はれま〔晴間〕
〈名〉An interval of clear weather; a lull in the rain

content.content: 晴れ間を見て帰ることにしよう
I shall leave when there is a lull.

content:
はれもの〔腫物〕
〈名〉A swelling; a boil

content.content: 腫れ物にさわるようにして器械を扱う
I must handle the instrument gingerly.
あれは腫れ物に触れるような男だ
He is an awkward customer to deal with.
出物腫物ところ嫌わず
“Necessity knows no law.”

content:
はれる〔腫れる〕
〈自動〉To swell

content.content: 脚気で足が腫れる
Beriberi swells the legs.
足が腫れた
My legs are swollen.

content:
はれる〔晴れる〕
〈自動〉
1. To clear (up)

content.content: 空が晴れる
The sky clears.
天気が晴れる
The weather clears up.
晴れそうだ
The weather promises to clear.
天気が晴れた
The weather has cleared up―The weather is clear.
雨が晴れたか
Has it stopped raining?
雨が晴れた
It has stopped raining―The rain has ceased―The rain has held up―The rain has let up.
霧が晴れる
The fog clears off―The fog lifts.
疑いが晴れる
A mystery is cleared up.
疑い晴れた
(疑った人が言えば)My mind is cleared from suspicion―(疑われた人が言えば)―I am cleared of suspicion―(第三者が言えば)―The suspicion is cleared up.
気が晴れる
I feel cheerful.
綺麗な庭を見ると気が晴れる
The sight of a beautiful garden is cheering.
散歩すると気が晴れる
A walk cheers one up.
今日は気の晴れない日だ
The weather is depressing today.
それで胸が晴れた
You have convinced me―I am convinced.
これを見たら君も胸が晴れるだろう
This will convince you.

content:
ばれる
〈自動〉
1. (=計略などが破れる)(a design) is baffled, is baulked, is defeated, is foiled, is frustrated

content.content: 事がばれた

content: 2. (=秘密が露顕する)(a secret) is discovered, is found out, comes to light

content.content: 事がばれた
The murder is out!

content:

content.content: ハワイ人
a Hawaiian

to seal a bond―affix one's seal to a document―put one's stamp on a paper
判を彫る

content.content: 半日
half a day
半時間
half an hour―a half hour
半年
half a year―a half year
半マイル
half a mile―a half mile
一時半
half past one

content: 2. (=奇数)an odd number; odd

content.content: 丁か半か
Odd or even?

content: 〈接頭詞〉Semi-; hemi-; demi-

content.content: 半円
a semicircle

半神

content:

content.content: 叛を謀る
to plot a rebellion―brew a rebellion

content:
はん〔汎〕
〈接頭詞〉Pan-

content.content: 汎独主義
pan-Germanism

はん〔版〕
〈名〉
1. (=版木)a block; a printing-block

content.content: 版を彫る
to engrave a block

content: 2. (=印刷)print; printing

content.content: 細かな版
small print―close print
大きな版
large print
版が悪いから読みにくい
The print is bad―The book is badly printed―and hard to read.

content: 3. (=第何版の版)an edition

content.content: 第十版
the tenth edition
版を重ねる
to go through several editions―run into several editions
本書ここに十版を重ぬ
The book has gone through ten editions―run into ten editions―gone into its tenth edition―reached its tenth edition.

to publish a new edition
改版
a revised edition

content.content: 初犯、三犯
one's first offence―one's third offence

content:

content.content: 救護班
a relief party

content.content: 応接の繁に堪えず

content: 2. (=繁雑)complex

content.content: 教科書は簡より繁に入る
A text-book should be graded―graduated.

content:

content.content: 藩主
a feudal lord

a clansman―a retainer

はん〔範〕

content.content: 範を垂る
to set an example to others
本邦の海軍は範を英国に取る
The Japanese navy is modelled on―modelled after―the British.

content:
はん〔煩〕
〈名〉Trouble

content.content: 煩に堪えず
I find it too troublesome.

content:
はん〔飯〕

1. (=めし)boiled rice
2. (=食事)a meal (breakfast, lunch, dinner, supper)

content.content: ご飯ですよ
Breakfast is ready.
(召使いが)ご飯ができました
Dinner is served.

content:
ばん〔判〕
〈名〉The size (of paper); the format (of a book)

content.content: 大判(中判、小判)の紙
large-sized paper―medium-sized paper―small-sized paper
四六版
a duodecimo
菊版
an octavo

content:
ばん〔晩〕
〈名〉
1. Evening:(副詞に用いれば) in the evening

content.content: 晩になった
Evening has set in―Evening has closed in.
晩に明日の下読みをする
I must read up for tomorrow in the evening.
晩は家におります
I am at home in the evening.
あの晩は(あの晩に限って)宅にいなかった
I was not at home (on) that evening―on that particular evening.［注意］「一般の晩」には前置詞“in”を用い、「特別の晩」には“on”を用いる。
土曜の晩は出かけるか
Do you go out on Saturday evening?
日曜の晩などに遊びに来給え
Come to see me of a Sunday evening.
彼は朝早く出て晩遅く帰る
He goes out early in the morning and comes home late in the evening―He goes out at an early hour and comes home at late hour.
三日の晩に遅く、十時に着いた
I arrived on the evening of the 3rd―late in the evening of the 3rd―at 10 in the evening of the 3rd.
今晩
this evening
今晩は
Good evening!
昨晩
last evening
明晩
tomorrow evening

content: 2. night

content.content: 朝から晩まで
from morning till night―from dawn till dusk
毎晩夢に見る
I dream it every night.
彼は毎晩毎晩夜ふかしする
He sits up till late night after night.
子どもがひと晩泣いた
The child kept crying all night―all the night through.

content:
ばん〔番〕
〈名〉
1. (=番号、番目)number

content.content: 一番、二番、三番
number one (No.1)―number two (No.2)―number three (No.3)
何番ですか
What number, please?
貴方は何番ですか
What is your number?
お宅の電話は何番ですか
What is your telephone number?
貴方の室は何番ですか
What is the number of your room?
五番室におります
I live in room No.5.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君は何番で及第したか
How do you stand on the list?
一番で及第した
I have passed first on the list―My name stands first on the list.
あの人は三番で卒業した
He has graduated third on the list.
十番
tenth on the list―ten down the paper
君は級で何番か
How do you stand in the class?
四番です
I am the fourth in the class.

content: 2. (=誰の番)one's turn:(競技なら)one's innings

content.content: 誰の番ですか
Whose turn is it?
今度は君の番だ
It is your turn next.
僕の番が来るのを待っている
I am waiting for my turn.
僕の番になった
My turn has come―It has come to my turn―It is my turn.
番に当たる
to have one's turn―(競技なら)―have one's innings
僕はもう番に当たった
I have had my turn―had my innings.
その時はちょうど僕が炊事をする番に当たった
It was my turn to do the cooking―I happened to be the cook.
番にあたったらやれ
You may play in your turn.
番でない時やっちゃいかん
You must not play out of your turn.
今日は当直の番に当たった
I am on duty today.
番がわりにやる、かわり番にやる
to play by turns―turn about―turn and turn about―(二人なら)―alternately

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 今度の演説は誰の番か
Who is the next speaker on the programme?
今度出るのは君の番だ
You are the next man on the cards.

content: 3. (=順番)order

content.content: 番が狂う
The order goes wrong.
番を狂わす
to disturb the order

content: 4. (=競技の番数)(how many) games, rounds, bouts

content.content: 一番やろうか
Will you have a game?
一番勝った、一番負けた
I have won a game―lost a game.
三番やって三番続けて勝った
I played three games, and won three times running.
三番勝負
a three-game match―(トランプなら)―a rubber (of whist).
三番勝負にしよう
The best in three games will be the winner.

content: 5. (=帽子などの何番)size

content.content: お帽子は何番ですか
What size is your hat?

content: 6. (=見張番)watch; guard

content.content: 番をする
to keep watch―stand guard
厳重に番をせよ
Keep strict watch!―Keep watch and ward!
宝の番をする
to guard the treasure―watch over the treasure―keep watch over the treasure―stand guard over the treasure
宝の番をせぬ
to leave the treasure to guard itself
入口の番をする
to guard the entrance―keep the door
入口の番をせぬ
to leave the door to keep itself
入口の番をする者が無い
There is no one to keep the door―(を通例)―The door is left to keep itself.
巡査が家の番をしている
A policeman is on guard over the house.
家には番がつけてある
The house is under guard.
店の番をする
to tend the shop―(は英、米は)―tend the store
火の番をする
to watch for a fire
泥棒の番をする
to watch for a thief
泥棒の番には泥棒が好し(蛇の道は蛇)
Set a thief to watch for a thief.
犬が家の番をする
The dog watches the house.
猫に鰹節の番、盗人に金の番をさせる(に相当するは)
to set a wolf to watch the sheep―put a wolf in the fold―trust a cat with milk
子どもが花を取らないように番をして下さい
See that the children do not pluck the flowers.

そんなことは万あるまい

パンにバタを付ける

パンの皮
crust
パンの心
crumb

パン屋

content.content: パンは命の綱
“Bread is the staff of life.”
人はパンのみにて生きるものにあらず
“Man liveth not by bread alone.”

to work for one's bread

bread-studies
パンにバタを付ける
to butter one's bread

bread and butter

一片のパン

content:
はんい〔範囲〕
〈名〉Extent; one's sphere (of influence); one's range (of study); one's field (of inquiry); the scope (of intellect); the compass (of thought); the purview (of a law); the province (of science); the region (of philosophy); the limits (of one's authority); the bounds (of human reason); a circle (of acquaintance)

content.content: 研究範囲
one's range of study―one's field of inquiry
我々は研究範囲を同じくする
We have covered the same ground.
彼の研究は範囲が広い
His study is of great extent―His study extends over a wide range.
僕の研究は範囲が狭い
My study is of small extent―confined within a narrow compass―confined within narrow limits―confined within narrow bounds.
彼は勢力範囲が広い
He has a wide sphere of influence.
そこは日本の勢力範囲内(外)である
The place is within our sphere of influence―outside our sphere of influence.
活動範囲
one's sphere of activity―one's field of action
彼は活動範囲が広い(舞台が大きい)
He has a wide sphere of activity―a large field of action―a large stage to play on.
活動範囲が狭い
He has a narrow sphere of activity―a small field of action―a small stage of play on.
利益範囲(内外)
within our sphere of interest―outside our sphere of interest
科学範囲内(外)の問題
questions within the province of science―beyond the province of science
人智の範囲内(外)の事柄
things within the scope of human intellect―beyond the scope of human intellect
この法律の範囲内(外)の犯罪
crimes within the purview of this law―beyond the purview of this law
理性の範囲内(外)の道理
truths within the bounds of reason―beyond the bounds of reason
彼は読書範囲が広い
His reading is of wide range―His reading is extensive.
用語範囲が広い、用語範囲が狭い
He has an extensive vocabulary―a limited vocabulary.
思想の範囲が広い
He has a wide compass of thought―a mind of wide scope.
交際範囲が広い
He has a large circle of acquaintance.
中学課程の範囲内で、範囲外にわたらずに英語を教えなければならなぬ
English must be taught within the limits of the middle-school curriculum―without going beyond the limits of the middle-school curriculum.
小笠原島は東京府の管轄範囲に属する
The Bonin Islands are under the jurisdiction of Tokyo prefecture.
年齢は十七から七十までの範囲にわたっている
The age ranges between seventeen and seventy.

1. (=相違する)to contradict (each other); to be contrary to (reason); to run counter to (one's interests); to go against (one's principles); to be adverse to (one's interests); to be at variance with (each others); to be inconsistent with (each other); to disagree with (each other); to belie (expectations):(形容詞に訳せば)contrary

His action contradicts his words―His actions are inconsistent with his words―His actions are not in keeping with his words.
皆の話が相反している
The accounts contradict each other―disagree with each other―The accounts are at variance with each other.
結果は予想に反する
The result is contrary to expectation―contrary to our expectations.
予想に反して事が成功した

意志に反して(不本意ながら)承諾した

content:
はんたい〔反対〕
〈名〉
1. Opposition; objection; protestation; remonstrance; antagonism; contrariety; antithesis:(=の) opposite (to each other); contrary (to each other); antagonistic (to each other); antithetical (to each other); antipodal (to each other); reverse (order); inverted (order):(=に) on the contrary:(=する) to oppose (a plan); to be opposed to (a plan); to set oneself against, set one's face against (a plan); to be set against (a plan); to vote against (a measure); to object to (a plan); to protest against (a measure); to remonstrate against (a measure); to dissent from (one's views); to antagonize (one's views, etc.)

content.content: 両親はこの縁談に反対だ
My parents are opposed to the match―set against the match―against the match.
母は賛成だが父が反対だ
My mother is for it, but my father is against it.
僕はこの計画には全然反対だ、あくまで反対だ、どこまでも反対だ
I am dead against the plan.
僕は平和に賛成だ、戦争には反対だ
I am for peace―against war.
彼も戦争に大反対だ
He is strong against war.
僕は洋行したいのだが母が反対で(不承知で)
I wish to go abroad, but my mother objects to the plan―she will not hear of it.
僕の意見は君と反対だ
My views are opposite to yours―I must dissent from your views―I must differ with you.
僕の意見は君とは正反対だ
My views are diametrically opposite to yours―diagonally opposite to yours.
二人の性質は正反対
Their natures are contrary to each other―antithetical to each other―antagonistic to each other―antipodal to each other.
彼の性質は僕の性質と正反対だ
His natures is contrary to mine―antithetical to mine―the exact antithesis of mine.
反対の性質
(強弱の如き相容れ得る反対なら)opposite natures―(気長と気短かの如き氷炭相容れざる反対なら)―contrary natures―antithetical natures―antagonistic natures―antipodal natures
彼は謙遜家のようだが実は正反対だ
He seems to be modest, but quite the contrary―the reverse is the case.
それとは反対に彼は非常に傲慢だ
On the contrary, he is very proud.
甲は乙の謙遜の反対に傲慢だ
He is as proud as the other is modest.
反対の声
a dissentient voice
この処置には反対の声があった
There was an outcry against this measure.
順序を反対にする
to reverse the order―invert the order
反対の順序に並べる
to arrange in the reverse order
反対の方向に進む
to proceed in the opposite direction
夢は反対に解釈するもの
Dreams should be interpreted by contraries.

捕虜に番兵をつける
to place a prisoner under guard―(つけておく)―keep a prisoner under guard
捕虜には番兵がついている
The prisoner is under guard.

content:
はんべつ〔判別〕
〈名〉Distinction:(=する) to distinguish (between the two―one from the other)

content.content: 是非を判別する
to distinguish between right and wrong

content.content: はべる〔侍る〕

The young crow shows its gratitude to its parents by feeding them in return.

はんぼいん〔半母音〕
〈名〉A semi-vowel

content:
はんぼう〔繁忙〕
〈名〉Press of business; pressure of business; busyness:(形容詞に用いれば)(to be) busy, pressed with business

content.content: 事務繁忙を極む
We are pressed with business―We live in a whirl of business.
近頃は繁忙で読書する暇も無い
I have been too busy to read.
繁忙で手がまわらぬ
We are hampered by press of business.
ご繁忙のところを恐れ入りますが(ご繁忙のところをお邪魔してすみません)
I am sorry to intrude on your precious time.

はんぽん〔版本〕
〈名〉A printed book

はんま〔半間〕
〈形〉Stupid

content.content: 半間な奴だなー
How stupid you are!

はんまい〔飯米〕
〈名〉Rice for daily consumption

〈名〉
1. (=道の半分)half-way
2. (=半里)half-a-ri

content:
