〈名〉The millions; the people

content.content: 万民はその堵に安んず
The people can now live in peace.

はんむ〔繁務〕
〈名〉Press of business; pressure of business; busyness

content:
ばんめ〔番目〕
〈序数名詞〉

content.content: 一番目
the first
二番目
the second
三番目
the third
十番目
the tenth
二十番目
the twentieth
三十番目
the thirtieth
何番目
What number?―How manieth? ［注意］これは“twentieth,”“thirtieth”にならえる新造語にて英語唯一の欠乏を補うもの、未だ辞典の認むところにあらざればこれを用いるも用いざるも随意なり。
その人は右から何番目か
What number is he from the right?
右から七番目の人
It is the seventh man from the right.
兄弟中で君は何番目か
What brother are you?―How manieth brother are you?
三番目
I am the third brother.
あの人は松田さんの何番目の息子か
What son is he―How manieth son is he―of Mr. Matsuda?
四番目
He is the fourth son.
Harding は何番目の大統領か
How manieth president was Mr. Harding?

content:
はんめいする〔判明する〕
〈自動〉
1. To become known; to become clear

content.content: この事実はどうして判明したか
How did this fact become known?
その理由はたちまち判明した
The reason soon became clear.
彼の行方は未だ判明せず
His destination is still unknown.

content: 2. (=何と判明する)to prove, turn out, be found out (to be true or false)

content.content: 問い合わせてみたら風説が事実と判明した
On enquiry, the rumour proved true.
風説は事実無根と判明した
The rumour turned out false―proved to be unfounded.
その男は偽物と判明した
The man turned out to be an impostor―He was found out to be a fraud.

content: 3. (=何者と身元判明する)to be identified as (such and such a person)

content.content: 死体は商人の娘と判明した
The body has been identified as a merchant's daughter.
男の死体はまだ何者とも判明せず
The man is not yet identified.

content:
ばんめし〔晩飯〕
〈名〉The evening meal; supper:(英国にては)tea

content.content: 晩飯を食う
to sup―take supper―eat one's supper
晩飯に何を食ったか
What did you have for supper?―What did you sup on?
晩飯に肉と野菜を食った
I had meat and vegetables for supper―I supped on meat and vegetables.
行ってみると家族は晩飯の最中
I found the famity at supper.
彼は晩飯を食わすに寝ることが往々あった
He had often to go without his supper.

content:
はんめん〔半面〕
〈名〉One side, one half (of anything)

content.content: 君は彼を半面しかまだ見ない
You have seen only one side of his character.
この話にはこっけいな半面がある
There is a comical side to the story.
半面の真理
a half-truth
君の言う事には半面の真理がある
There is some truth in what you say―There is something in that.

はんめん〔反面〕
〈名〉The reverse; the back

はんめんかん〔半面観〕
〈名〉One-sided view

content:
はんめんしき〔半面識〕
〈名〉A slight acquaintance; a bowing acquaintance

content.content: あの人とは半面識だ
I am only slightly acquainted with him―on bowing terms with him―on nodding terms with him.

はんめんぞう〔半面像〕
〈名〉A profile:(影なら)a silhouette

content:
はんも〔繁茂〕
〈名〉Luxuriance:(=せる) luxuriant (vegetation); rank (weeds); thick (wood):(=する) to luxuriate; to be luxuriant; (weeds) grow rank; (leaves) grow thick

content.content: 熱帯地方は植物が繁茂する
Plants luxuriate in the tropics.
山には草木が繁茂している
The hills are covered with luxuriant vegetation.
樹木繁茂して昼なお暗し

There is such a luxuriant growth of trees that the sun's rays can not penetrate the depths of the thicket―The sun can not penetrate the luxuriant foliage of trees―The luxuriant foliage of trees make a twilight of noon-day.
庭には雑草が繁茂している
The garden is overgrown with rank weeds.
枝が繁茂している
The branches spread far and wide.

はんもう〔半盲〕
〈形〉Half-blind; purblind; starblind

content:
はんもく〔反目〕
〈名〉Variance:(=する) to be at variance, at odds, at loggerheads at daggers drawn, at swords' points (with each other)

content.content: 兄弟が相反目している
The brothers are at variance with each other―There is no love lost between the brothers.

content:
ばんもつ〔万物〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ばんぶつ〔万物〕

content:
はんもと〔版元〕
〈名〉A publisher

content.content: 版元から一部取寄せてみよう
I will send to the publisher's for a copy.

はんももひき〔半股引〕
〈名〉Short drawers

はんもん〔反問〕
〈名〉Cross-examination; cross-questioning:(=する) to cross-examine, cross-question (the witness)

content:
はんもん〔斑紋〕
〈名〉Spots; speckles

content.content: 蝮蛇は斑紋がある
A viper is speckled.

content:
はんもん〔煩悶〕
〈名〉Agony; worry; conflicting emotions; contending passions; a struggle:(=する) to agonize; to be agonized; to be in agony; to writhe (in anguish); to struggle with oneself; to worry (oneself)

content.content: 失恋の結果煩悶している
She is writhing from disappointment in love.
煩悶の極み、自害した
Unable to bear his agonies, he committed suicide―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Agony drove him to suicide.
煩悶の極み、華厳の瀧へ飛び込んだ
Agony drove his to leap down the Kegon Falls.
君はなにか煩悶があるか
Have you anything weighing on your mind?―a load on your mind?
心中煩悶している
I am worrying within myself.
義理と情けの煩悶
a struggle between love and duty

content:
はんや〔半夜〕
〈名〉Half a night:(=の) half-night

content.content: 半夜灯
half-night lighting

content:
はんやけ〔半焼け〕
〈名〉Partial destruction by fire

content.content: 家は半焼で済んだ
The house was only partially destroyed by fire―half burnt.
半焼けは丸焼けより始末が悪い
Partial destruction is worse than total destruction.

content:
ばんゆう〔蛮勇〕
〈名〉(事)barbarous courage; foolhardy courage; dare-devil courage; reckless valour; recklessness; rashness; temerity; Bohemianism:(人)a Bohemian

content.content: あの人は蛮勇肌がある
He has something of the Bohemian in his composition.
蛮勇を振う
to show reckless valour

content:
ばんゆう〔万有〕
〈名〉The universe

content.content: 万有精神論
animism
万有神教
pantheism

ばんゆうしんきょう〔万有神教〕
〈名〉Pantheism

content:
はんらん〔叛乱〕
〈名〉A rebellion; a revolt; an insurrection; a rising:(=する) to rebel, revolt, rise (against the government)

content.content: 叛乱を起こす
to brew a rebellion―rise in revolt
叛乱を鎮定する
to suppress a rebellion

content:
はんらん〔氾濫〕
〈名〉Inundation; spate; a flood; a freshet:(=する) to overflow (its banks); to inundate (a country)

content.content: 河が氾濫する
A river overflows.
河が氾濫している
The river is in flood―in spate.
エジプトはナイル河が年々氾濫する
Egypt is inundated by the Nile―The Nile inundates Egypt―every year.
エジプトの豊饒なるはナイル河の氾濫に起因す
The fertility of Egypt is due to the inundation of the Nile.

ばんりのちょうじょう

ばんりのちょうじょう〔万里の長城〕
〈固名〉The Great Wall (of China)

content:
ばんりのはとう〔万里の波濤〕
〈名〉The rolling seas

content.content: 彼らは万里の波濤を越えて来る
They come over the rolling seas―Seas roll between this land and the land from whence they come.
君は万里の波濤を越えて行く
You are going over the rolling seas―Seas shall roll between you and me.

はんりゅうどうたい〔半流動体〕
〈名〉A semi-liquid

content:
はんりょ〔伴侶〕
〈名〉A companion

content.content: 本書は学生の好伴侶なり
The book is a good companion for students.
この本は旅行中の好伴侶であった
The book was a good companion on my journey.

ばんりょくそうちゅうこういってん

ばんりょくそうちゅうこういってん〔万緑叢中紅一点〕
〈熟語〉The one bright spot amidst dark surroundings; an oasis in the desert; (a phrase often used in referring to) the only lady in the assembly

content:
はんるい〔煩累〕
〈名〉Annoyances; troubles

content.content: 人生は煩累多し
Life is full of troubles.

はんれい〔凡例〕
〈名〉An introduction (to a book)

content:
はんろ〔販路〕
〈名〉A market (for one's goods); demand

content.content: 物品の販路を開く
to find a market for one's goods
品物は外国に販路が開けた
The goods have found a market in foreign countries.
販路を拡張する
to extend the market―enlarge the market―for one's goods
この品は販路が広い
There is a good market for these goods―There is a large demand for these goods―These goods are in great demand.
販路の広い品
a marketable article―a salable article―a merchantable article
この品は販路が狭い
There is a small demand for these goods―These goods are in little demand.
販路の狭い品
an unmarketable article―an unsalable article
日貨排斥のためにこの品の販路が杜絶した
Owing to the boycott of Japanese goods, the demand for the article is at an end.

content:
はんろう〔煩労〕
〈名〉Trouble

content.content: この煩労を免れたならありがたい
I should be glad to be relieved of the trouble.
仕事を引受けてまた煩労をふやした
I have added to my trouble by undertaking the work.
また新著述を出して世間の煩労をふやした
I have inflicted another work on the long-suffering public.

はんろん〔汎論〕
〈名〉An outline; a summary; general remarks

はんわけ〔半分け〕
〈名〉Going halves:(=する) to go halves; to go shares

content:
ひ〔火〕
〈名〉
1. Fire

content.content: 火を焚く
to make a fire―make a blazing fire
汽缶の火を焚く
to stoke a boiler―fire a locomotive
火を焚きつける
to kindle a fire―light a fire
火が燃える
Fire burns.
火を燃やす
to make the fire burn
火がなかなか燃えない
The fire will not burn―I can not make the fire burn.
火を起こす
to kindle a fire―make a charcoal fire
火が起こる
Fire kindles―The charcoal begins to burn.
火が起こった
The fire has kindled.
火がなかなり起こらぬ
The charcoal will not burn―I can not make the charcoal burn.
火に当たる
to warm myself at the fire―sit over the fire―cower over the fire―nurse the fire―hung the fire
火を焚いて当たった
We made a blazing fire and warmed ourselves at it.
彼は一日火に当たってばかりいる
He hungs the chimney-corner all day.
火の無いところに待たされた
I was kept waiting in the cold.
鍋に火をかける
to put a pot over the fire
この土瓶は火にかけても大丈夫か
Will the tea-pot stand the fire?
火を扇ぐ
to fan the fire
火を吹く
to blow the fire
火を生ける
to bank up the fire
火に灰をかける
to damp the fire
火を引く
to remove the fire
火を切る
to strike a spark
火であぶる
to hold anything over the fire
火にあぶると匂いが抜ける
Show it the fire, and the smell will go off.
火を通す
to broil fish―toast bread―do meat thoroughly
この魚は火が通らぬ
The fish is not done enough.
火が消える
The fire goes out.
火を消す
to put out the fire―extinguish the fire
火の消えぬように
Keep the fire alive!―Keep the fire in!
全都火の消えたよう
The whole city has a deserted air―a desolate air.
彼がいないと家の中は火の消えたようだ
His absence makes the house look desolate.
火が燃え切る
The fire burns itself out.
煙あれば火あり
Where there is a smoke, there is fire―There is no smoke without fire.
馬蹄から火がでる
The hoofs strike fire.
目から火が出る
It strikes sparks out of my eyes―I see stars.
鰭は目から火を放つ
His eyes flash fire.
火を発する
to ignite
揮発油が火を発する
Gasoline ignites.
顔から火が出るようだった
I felt a burning shame―My face was on fire.
満面火のよう
He is all in a glow.
火をみるよりも明らか
It is as clear as day.
飛んで火に入る夏の虫
to fly in the face of Providence
たとい火の中水の底
I will go through fire and water for your sake.
家の中は火の車
They are in great straits.
火を擦るように
at a white heat
火を擦るように争う
to dispute at a white heat
舌端火を飛ばす
He argues at a white heat.

content: 2. (=火事の火)fire; the flames; the conflagration

content.content: 火がつく
to catch fire―take fire
着物に火がついた
My clothes caught fire.
家に火がついた
The house caught fire.
隣家に火が移った
The fire spread to the neighbouring house―The neighbouring house caught fire.
鉋屑に火がついたよう
to burn like tow
鉋屑に火のついたような熱心
volatile enthusiasm
赤児が火のついたように泣いた
The baby cried at the top of its lungs.
揮発油は火がつきやすい
Gasoline is highly inflammable.
焼木杭には火がつきやすい
“Old pottage is sooner heated than new”―An old flame is soon revived.
ランプが破裂して家に火がついた
A lamp burst and set the house on fire.
あの家にも火がついた
That house is on fire―in flames.
家は見る見る一面の火となった
The house was soon in a blaze.
火をつける
to set fire to a house―commit incendiarism―commit arson
敵は村落に火を放った
The enemy set fire to the village.
火を消す、火を防ぐ
to fight the fire―keep the fire under―check the conflagration
火の手
a tongue of fire
火の手が上がる
Tongues of fire shoot up.
炎々たる火の手
flaring tongues of fire
炎々たる火の手があがる
Tongues of fire flare up.
火を噴く
to emit fire
火の用心
precautions against fire
火の用心をする
to take precautions against fire
火の用心(なさりませ)
Take care of the fire!
火事の後の火の用心
“The stable-door is shut after the horse is stolen.”
火の番をする
to watch for fire
金庫は火に堪える
An iron-safe is proof against fire.
火の中へ飛び込んで女を助けた
I rescued the woman from the flames.

content: 3. (=おき)a live coal; a red coal; embers

content.content: 火箸で火をはさむ
to hold a live coal with the tongs―take up a red coal with the tongs
火消し壺へいれて火を消す
to extinguish the embers in the pot

content: 4. (=ともし火)a light

content.content: 火をとぼす
to burn a light―keep a light burning
爪に火をとぼす
to skin a flint
火を打つ
to strike a light
火をつける
to light a lamp―light a candle
火を消せ
Put out the light!―Out with the light!―(泥棒の符牒では)―Douse the glim!
寝る時は火を細くして
Turn down the light when you go to bed.
遠方に火が見える
I see a light in the distance―a distant light.

content: 5. (=タバコの火)a light; a tobacco-light; a cigar-light

content.content: タバコに火をつける
to light a pipe―light a cigar―light a cigarette―light up
タバコの火を交換する
to exchange cigar-lights

content:
ひ〔日〕
〈名〉
1. (=太陽)the sun

content.content: 日が出る
The sun rises (above the horizon)―The sun comes up.
日が出た
The sun has risen―The sun is up.
日の出
sunrise
日の出に発った
We started at sunrise.
初日の出
the first sunrise of the year
彼は日の出の勢いだ
His star is in the ascendant―He is a rising man.
日が入る
The sun sets―The sun goes down.
日は西山に入る
The sun sinks below the horizon.
日が入った
The sun has set―The sun is down.
日の入らぬ国は英領
the Empire on which the sun never sets
日は東から出て西に入る
The sun rises in the east, and sets in the west.
日が西から出てもこの決心は変わらぬ
If the sun were to rise in the west, my resolution would be unchanged.
日の入り
sunset―sundown
日の入りに着いた
We arrived at sunset―at sundown.
日の入り前に、日の入り後に
before dark―after dark
日が照る
The sun shines.
ここばかりは日が照らぬ
The sun shines everywhere―I have all the world before me.
日が当たる
The sun shines on anything.
縁側に日が当たる
The sun shines on the verandah.
日が当たってきた
The sun begins to shine.
日の当たることろ(日向)で遊ぶな
Do not play in the sun.
日の当たらないことろ(日蔭)におれ
Keep in the shade.
日が当たって黒板かちらつく
The sunlight glances on the blackboard―The blackboard glances in the sun.
この家はよく日が当たる
The house is sunny―full of sunshine.
日に当たる
to sun oneself―expose oneself to the sun―bask in the sun―bathe in the sunlight
日に当てる、日にさらす
to expose anything to the sun
日に干す
to dry anything in the sun
濡れた着物は日に干しておいた
My wet clothes are drying in the sun.
日が差す
The sun shines in.
目を覚ましてみると日が差し込んでいた
I awoke to find the sun shining into the room.
白壁に日が差す
The sunlight strikes (against) the white wall.
日に焼ける
to be burned by the sun―browned by the sun―tanned by the sun
日に焼けた顔
a sun-burnt face―a sun-browned face―a tanned face
日をよける
to keep off the sun―shield oneself from the sun―screen anything from the sun
日がまだ高い
The sun is still high.
日が傾く
The sun declines―The day declines.

content: 2. (=一昼夜)a day

content.content: あの日は行かなかった
I did not go (on) that day.
その日はさしつかえがあって行かれない
Business prevents my going on that day.
ある日のこと友人が遊びに来た
One day, a friend came to see me.
日に三度、飯を食う
We eat three times a day.
若い時は日に十五里も歩いたものだ
In my young days, I used to do my fifteen leagues a day.
日を決める
to fix upon the day―name the day―make a date
日がまだ決まらぬ
The day is not yet fixed upon.
日を決めるのは女の役
It is for the lady to name the day.
日を経るに従って(日に増し)病人が快くなる
He grows better as the days go by―He daily grows better―He grows better and better every day.
日に増し丈夫になる
He daily grows stronger―He grows stronger and stronger every day.
日一日と暑さが加わる
The heat daily grows greater―The heat grows greater and greater every day.
いざ鎌倉という日には、事有るの日には一身をなげうって国家に尽す決心だ
I will lay down my life for my country in the day of trouble―in time of need―in case of emergency―in an emergency.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 失敗した日にゃ乞食だ
I shall be beggar in case of failure―in case I fail―if I fail.
これを始めて日尚浅し
It is only a short time since I began it.
彼は開業して日がまだ浅い
It is not long since he set up in business―He is young in his business.
去る者は日に疎し
“Out of sight, out of mind.”

content: 3. (=昼間)day; daytime

content.content: 春は日が長くなる
The days grow longer―The day gains on the night―in spring.
夏は日が長い
The days are long in summer.
秋は日が短くなる
The days grow shorter―The night gains on the day―in autumn.
冬は日が短い
The days are short in winter.
日が暮れる
Night falls.
今何時に日が暮れるか
What time does night fall at this time of the year?
日の暮れないうちに着けるか
Can we get there before dark?
日が暮れてから着く
We shall arrive after dark.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: グズグズしていると日が暮れるぞ
Are you going to finish it today?
ばかにかまうと日が暮れる
You will waste words on a fool.
女ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
Woman is the light of life.
君ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
You are the light of my life―the light of my eye―the light of the household.
夜を日に継いで働く
to work night and day―work double tides―work double hours

content: 4. (=日付け)date

content.content: 手紙に日付を入れる
to date a letter
手紙に日が書いてない
The letter is undated.
日を決める
to fix upon the date

content: 5. (=時)time

content.content: どうして日を暮らすか
How do you pass your time?―spend your time?―(米国では)―put in your time?
読書をして日を暮らす
I spend my time in reading―devote my time to reading.
老人は読書と庭いじりに日を暮らしている
The old man divides his time―passes his time―between the library and the garden.
遊んで日を暮らす
to play one's time away―idle one's time away
ブラブラして日を暮らす
to dawdle one's time away―lounge one's time away
グズグズして日を暮らす
to dally one's time away―mope one's time away
便々と日を送る
to dawdle away one's time
ビクビクしてその日を送る
to live in fear (of one's life)
あくせくと日を送る
to pass a restless day
どうしてその日を送るか
How do you live?―get your living?―gain your livelihood?
後に残れる妻や子は
My wife and little ones I leave behind―
どうして其日を送るやら
Oh, how shall they their means of living find?
かながなその日を送る
to make a bare living
どうかこうかその日を送る
to rub through life―scratch along
どうやらこうやらその日その日を送っている
He manages somehow or other to live.
その日暮らし
a hand-to-mouth existence―(する)―to live from hand to mouth

content.content: 可とする者と否とする者

可とする者百五十に対し否とする者二百
There are 200 noes against 150 ayes.
否とする者多数
The noes have it.

content:

content.content: 妃殿下

content:
ひ〔比〕
〈名〉
1. (=比較)comparison

content.content: 甲の如きは乙の比にあらず
A is inferior to B beyond comparison―A is no match for B―A is not a patch upon B―There is no comparison between the two.
甲は乙などの比にあらず
A is superior to B beyond comparison―There is no comparison between the two.
米国の富は日本の比にあらず
America is richer than Japan beyond comparison.
僕の勉強などはとうてい君の比でない
My diligence is nothing to yours―nothing as compared with yours―nothing in comparison with yours―I am no match for you in diligence―not a patch upon you in diligence.
これしきの艱難は海員生活の比にあらず
These hardships are nothing to a sailor's life―a Paradise to a sailor's life.
同日の比にあらず
They are not to be named on the same day.

content: 2. (=比すべきもの)an equal; a rival; a peer; a match; a parallel

content.content: 天下に比無し、世界にその比を見ず
If has no equal in the world―It is unequalled―unrivalled―unparallelled―unmatched―matchless―peerless―unique.
この戦乱は古今その比を見ず
This war has no parallel in history.

the cost of living
米国では生活費はいくらかかるか
What does living cost in America?

Living costs fifty dollars.

content:
ひ〔非〕
〈名〉
1. (=誤り、過ち、欠点)a mistake; an error; a fault

content.content: 人の非を挙げる
to mention one's faults
彼の非を挙げるのはただご注意のため
I only mention his faults to warn you against him.
熱心に彼の非を説いた
I earnestly reasoned with him on his mistake.
己が非を悟る
to be convinced of one's error
己が非を掩う
to gloss over one's faults
非を鳴らす
to censure―denounce
非を打つ
to blame a fault―censure one's conduct―find fault with anything
この品は非の打ちどころが無い
This articles is faultless―perfect.
万事非の打ちどころが無い
Everything is as it should be.
彼は教師として非の打ちどころが無い
He is everything a teacher should be―an ideal teacher.
彼の処置は非の打ちどころが無い
His conduct is above reproach.
この文章は非の打ちどころが無い
The style leaves nothing to be desired.
彼の支度は非の打ちどころが無い
His dress is unimpeachable.
非の打ちどころの無い細君だ
She is an ideal wife.
非の打ちどころの無い紳士だ
He is a perfect gentleman.
非を打たれるようなことをするな
Refrain from such actions as will lay you open to censure―Do not lay yourself open to censure!

content:
〈形〉
1. (=是非、理非の非)(right or) wrong

content.content: どちらに理があるか、どちらが非か
Which is in the right? Which is in wrong?
原告の方が非だ
The plaintiff is in the wrong.
彼は自分の非を認めている
He acknowledges himself to be in the wrong.
理を非にする
to talk right into wrong
理が非でも手に入れなければならぬ
Right or wrong I must needs―possess myself of the article.
この処置を是とする者あり、非とするものあり
Some say the measure is right, others say it is wrong―Some approve of the measure, others disapprove of it.
是を是とし非を非とするに何をかはばからん
What can deter me from calling right right and wrong wrong?
是を是とし非を非とする(是々非々)主義
an unbiassed policy
昨の是にして今の非なるを覚ゆ
I feel that what was right yesterday is wrong today.
昨是今非、昨非今是
vacillation
天道是か非か
(Is Providence right or wrong?―と言わずして)Is there divine justice in the world?
天道是か非かと叫ぶ
to accuse Heaven of injustice
非と知りつつ承諾した
I consented against my better judgment.

content: 2. (=不良)bad

content.content: 形勢ますます非なり
The situation grows worse and worse―goes from bad to worse.
形勢日に非なり
The situation daily grows worse―grows worse and worse every day.

content.content: 万事控え目にせよ

The buyers hold back―hang back.

content:
ひかえる〔控える〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=差控える)to desist from, refrain from, abstain from, keep from, forbear (doing something); to hold back, hang back

content.content: (相場が下がりそうなので)買手は控えている
The buyers hold back―hang back.
そんな冒険は控えた方がよくはないか
Hadn't you better desist from such risky enterprises?

僕は言いたいことを言わずに控えている
I refrain from speaking my mind.
言おう言おうと思いながらつい遠慮して今まで控えておりました

僕は憤然席を蹴って立とうと思ったが長者の手前控えた

不敬にわたります、お控え召されい
You tread on forbidden ground. Desist!
控えおれ

閥が怖いために犯罪を控える者がある
Fear of punishment deters some people from crime.

content: 2. (=控え目にする)to be moderate (in doing anything); to be temperate (in eating and drinking)

content.content: 万事少し控えたがよい
Be moderate―Keep within bounds―in everything.

content:

〈名〉
1. Comparison:(=する) to compare (two things―one thing with another); to set (one thing against another); to weigh (one thing with or against another); to draw a parallel between (two events)

content.content: 翻訳を原文と比較しみた

How does the one compare with the other?
甲は乙と比較して遜色なし
The one compares favourably with the other.
日本の海軍は何国の海軍と比較しても遜色が無い
The Japanese navy compares favourably with any other.
甲は(劣っていて)乙と比較にならぬ
The one does not compare with the other―The one does not bear comparison with the other.
甲はとても乙と比較にならぬ
The one is nothing to the other―nothing as compared with the other―as nothing compared with the other―nothing in comparison with the other.
彼の英語は君とはとても比較にならぬ
His English is nothing to yours―He is no match for you in English―not a patch upon you in English.
二者は(優劣甚しく)比較にならぬ
There is no comparison between the two.
比較にならぬほどの絶景だ
The scenery is beautiful beyond comparison―beyond compare.
甲は乙と比較すれば気品が高い
The one, as compared with the other,―when set against the other,―is of a higher tone.
支那人は日本人と比較すれは背は高いが不活発だ
The Chinese, as compared with the Japanese, are taller but less active.
生徒数は昨年と比較すれば今年は増している
The number of students has increased this year as compared with last year.
他の作はこの作に比較すれは顔色なしだ
The other works pale beside this.
労働者の生活などは船乗りの生活と比較すれば極楽だ

to weigh the pros and cons―weigh one argument with another―weigh one argument against another
反対候補者の人物を比較する
to weigh the merits of the rival candidates
この両戦争を比較してみると面白い

1. (=紹介)introduction:(=る) to introduce, present (one person to another)

content.content: お引合わせをしましょう
I will introduce you to him.
君に逢ったのは仏の引合わせだ
My father's spirit has brought us together―made us acquainted.

content: 2. (=照らし合わせ)comparison; collation:(=る) to compare, collate, check (the goods with the invoice, etc.)

content.content: 品物を原簿と引合わせる
to check the goods with the ledger

content:
ひきいき〔引き息〕
〈名〉Gasp

content.content: 行ってみると病人は引き息になっていた
I found him at his last gasp.

content:
ひきいる〔率いる〕
〈他動〉To command (an army); to lead (one's men); to head (a body of men)

content.content: 彼は大軍を率いて敵に向かった
He went against the enemy at the head of a large army.
軍を率いる将
the general in command of the army
将の率いる軍
the army under the command of the general
ペルリが軍艦四艘を率いて浦賀へ来た
Commodore Perry came to Uraga with four men-of-war.
彼は人を率いるの器あり(器にあらず)
He has a talent for generalship―no talent for generalship.
我れらを率いて名誉の勝利を得せしめよ(部下の兵が名将に訴える)
Lead us to glory!

content:
ひきいれる〔引き入れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=引張り込む)to draw in; to pull in

content.content: 仲間に引入れられる
to be drawn into a company

content: 2. (=抱き込む)to win over, gain over, bring over, talk over (a person to one's side or views)

content.content: 彼を味方に引入れることはできないか
Can't you win him over to our side?―gain him over to our side?
彼を我が党に引入れてみせる
I will bring him over to my views―talk him over to my views―convert him to my views―make a convert of him.

content:
ひきうけ〔引受け〕
〈名〉Acceptance (of a bill)

content.content: (手形の)参加引受
acceptance for honour―supraprotest
一部引受
partial acceptance
手形の引受を拒む
to dishonour a note
引受拒絶
dishonour―non-acceptance

content:
ひきうけにん〔引受人〕
〈名〉A surety (for a debt); the guarantor (of payment); the acceptor (of a bill, etc.)

content.content: 身元引受人
a surety

content:
ひきうける〔引受ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=任に当たる)to undertake (a task); to take (a matter) in hand; to take (a trust) on oneself; to take up (an order)

content.content: この仕事をお引き受け下さらんか
Will you undertake the work?
仕事を引き受けた上は全力を尽します
Now that I have undertake the work, I will do my best.
彼が事件を引き受けてくれれば速やかに落着するであろう
If he will take the matter in hand, he will bring it to a speedy termination.
僕は向こう見ずに大任を引き受けてとんでもないことをした
I committed a folly in taking this great trust on myself head over heeds.
無能を顧みずこの重任を引き受けたのはこういう次第です
That is the reason why I have taken this important trust on myself without reflecting on my want of ability.
ちと大きな註文を引き受けて他のご註文はお断りしております
We have taken up a large order, and so we are obliged to decline all others.
敵を一手に引き受ける
I will engage the enemy single-handed.

content: 2. (=引取る)to take charge of (a person or thing); to take over (a business); to take (anything) off one's hands

content.content: 僕か孤児の世話を引き受ける
I will take charge of the orphans.
孤児の保護を引き受けよう
I will take the orphan under my protection.
営業事務は私が引き受けております
I have charge of the business―I am in charge of the business―The business is under my charge―in my charge―in my hands.
田舎者の案内を引き受けて東京中引張りまわした
I took charge of a countryman―took a bumpkin in tow―and took him all over the town.
私が店を引き受けましたからどうぞお引き立てを願います
I have taken over the business, and so I hope you will patronize me.
誰かこの厄介者を引き受けてくれればよい
I wish some one would take this burden off my hands.
ご不用なら僕が引き受けよう
If you do not want it, I will take it off your hands.

content: 3. (=受合う)to answer for (success); to hold oneself responsible for (the result); to hold oneself liable for (a debt); to guarantee (payment)

content.content: 事の成功は僕が引き受ける
I will answer for success―be responsible for success―hold myself responsible for success.
お身の安全は私の生命をもって引き受けます
I will answer for your safety with my life.
すべて損害は会社で引き受ける
The company holds itself responsible for all damages.
返済は僕が引き受ける
I will guarantee payment―I will be liable for the debt.

content: 4. (=責任を以て保証する)to see (to it―that something is done)

content.content: (人に用を頼まれて)よし引き受けた
Yes, I will see to it―see about it.
彼は金を返済することは僕が引き受けた
I will see that he pays you―see that you are paid―see you paid.
この金が先方の手に渡ることは僕が責任を負って引き受ける
I will see that he gets the money.

content: 5. (=承諾する)to consent to (a proposal); to comply with (a request)

content.content: 彼は僕の頼みを快く引き受けてくれた
He readily complied with my request.
手形の支払いを引き受ける
to accept a bill―honour a bill
病を引き受ける
to catch a disease―contract a disease
株を引き受ける
to subscribe for shares

content:
ひきうす〔碾臼〕
〈名〉A hand-mill; a quern

content.content: 碾臼をひく
to turn a hand-mill
碾臼でひく
to grind corn with a hand-mill

ひきうつし〔引写し〕
〈名〉Tracing:(=する) to trace (a map, etc.)

ひきうつす〔引き移す〕
〈他動〉To remove (the office to some other place)

content:
ひきうつる〔引移る〕
〈自動〉To remove (to another place); to move (into the neighbourhood)

content.content: 明日新宅へ引移ります
We move into the new house tomorrow.
家を借りて引移る
to enter into possession of a house

ひきおこす〔引き起す〕
〈他動〉To right (a leaning house)

content:
ひきおこす〔惹き起す〕
〈他動〉To cause (a war); to occasion (troubles); to bring about (a quarrel); to bring on (an illness); to raise (a question); to give rise to (a disturbance); to give occasion to (strife, etc.)

content.content: 改革が不平をひき起こした
The reform gave rise to dissatisfaction.

content:
ひきおろす〔引卸す、引下ろす〕
〈他動〉To pull down (a kite); to haul down (a flag); to drag down (a man); to tow off (a stranded ship)

content.content: 弁士を演壇から引下ろした
The speaker was dragged down from the platform.
座礁した船を軍艦が引下ろした
The stranded ship was towed off by a gunboat.

content:
ひきおろす〔引卸す、引下ろす〕
〈他動〉To pull down (a kite); to haul down (a flag); to drag down (a man); to tow off (a stranded ship)

content.content: 弁士を演壇から引下ろした
The speaker was dragged down from the platform.
座礁した船を軍艦が引下ろした
The stranded ship was towed off by a gunboat.

content:
ひきかえ〔引換え〕
〈名〉Exchange; conversion:(=る) to exchange, barter (one thing for another); to change, convert (paper into gold)

content.content: 請取証と引換えに金を渡す
to hand over the money in exchange for the receipt
現金と引換えに品物を渡す
to deliver the goods in exchange for cash
品物と引換えに現金を払う
to pay cash on delivery
品物と金を引換える
to exchange goods for money
物品と物品を引換える(物々交換)
to barter goods for goods
紙幣を金貨と引換える
to change paper into gold
手形を現金に引換える
to cash a note
古い紙幣を引換える(回収する)
to call in old notes
代金引換郵便
C. O. D.(=cash on delivery)post.

content:
ひきかえ〔引換え〕
〈副〉While; on the contrary; on the other hand

content.content: 甲の怜悧なのに引換えて乙は愚鈍だ
The one is clever, while (on the contrary,) the other is stupid―The one is as clever as the other is stupid.
それに引換えて日本人は勇敢だ
On the other hand, the Japanese are brave.
それに引換え今宵の難儀
And how different the hardships of this night!

content:
ひきかえす〔引返す〕
〈自動〉
1. To turn back; to retrace one's steps; to double on one's tracks:(船なら)to put back

content.content: もと来た路を引返す
to retrace one's steps―retrace one's way
途中から引返して来た
I turned back half-way.
船はシケに逢って引返した
We were compelled by stress of weather to put back.
風を引返す
to have a relapse of cold

content:
ひきかえて〔引換えて〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ひきかえ〔引換え〕

ひきかえばらい〔引換払い〕
〈名〉Cash on delivery(C. O. D.―と略す)

ひきがえる〔蟇蛙〕
〈名〉The toad

ひきがし〔引菓子〕
〈名〉Ornamental cakes(presented to the guests on a ceremonial occasion to be taken home)

ひきがたり〔弾き語り〕
〈名〉Singing to one's own samisen accompaniment:(=する) to sing to one's own samisen

content:
ひきがね〔引金〕
〈名〉The trigger (of a gun or a pistol)

content.content: 引金を引く
to pull the trigger

content:
ひききりなしに〔引切り無しに〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ひっきりなしに〔引切り無しに〕

content:
ひききる〔挽切る〕
〈他動〉To saw off

content.content: 木の枝を挽引切る
to saw off a bough

content:
ひきくらべる〔引比べる〕
〈他動〉To compare (another person with oneself)

content.content: 人の難儀を我が身に引き比べる
to enter into another's troubles

content:
ひきくるめる〔引きくるめる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ひっくるめる

ひきこ〔曳子〕
〈名〉A jinrikishaman (belonging to a jinrikisha-station)

ひきごと〔引事〕
〈名〉An allusion; a reference

content:
ひきこむ〔引き込む〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ひきいれる〔引き入れる〕

content:
ひきこもる〔引籠る〕
〈自動〉To keep one's bed (or room); to be confined to one's bed (or room); to be laid by the heels; to be laid up (with an illness)

content.content: 彼は病気でひきこもっている
He is laid up with an illness―confined to his bed―laid by the heels.
母は五六日前から風邪でひきこもっております
Mother has been laid up with a cold these few days.
父はリウマチが起こってひきこもっております
My father is laid up with an attack of rheumatism.
親の喪でひきこもる
to keep one's house in mourning for one's father

content:
ひきころす〔轢き殺す〕
〈他動〉To kill (a person) by running over (him)

content.content: 自動車に轢き殺される
to be run over and killed by a motor-car

content:
ひきざい〔誹譏罪〕
〈名〉Defamation; libel

content.content: 誹譏罪に問わる
to be charged with defamation

content:
ひきさがる〔引下がる〕
〈自動〉To retire; to withdraw; to make one's bow; to bow oneself out; to take oneself off; to make oneself scarce

content.content: ご用が無けりゃいつでも引き下がります
If you do not want me, I am ready to retire―ready to withdraw.
と言って引き下がった
With this, he withdrew―So saying, he bowed himself out of the room.
引き下がれ
Take yourself off!―Make yourself scarce!
ご前を引き下がる
to retire from the Imperial presence―withdraw from the Imperial presence

content:
ひきさく〔引裂く〕
〈他動〉To tear up (a letter); to rip up (a coat); to rend (one's garments)

content.content: 手紙をふんだくって引き裂いた
I snatched the letter from him, and tore it up―tore it to pieces.
怒って着物をビリビリ引き裂いた
He grew angry and ripped up his clothes―pulled his clothes to pieces―rent his garments.

ひきさげぐすり〔引下げ薬〕
〈名〉A sedative

content:
ひきさげる〔引下げる〕
〈他動〉
1. To bring down, lower, reduce (the price); to cut (the wages)
2.

content.content: 逆上を引下げる
to take a sedative

content:
ひきさる〔引去る〕
〈他動〉To deduct (one sum from another)

content.content: 収益から経費を引き去ると余すことろはほんの少しだ
When the expenses are deducted from the profits, there is only a very little left.
この金を月給から引き去っていただきたい
I wish to have the sum deducted from my salary.

content:
ひきしお〔退き潮〕
〈名〉The ebb-tide; low tide; low water

content.content: 今退き潮だ
The tide is ebbing―The tide is on the ebb.
暗礁は引潮には見える
The rocks are visible at low tide―at low water.

ひきしぼる〔引絞る〕
〈他動〉To draw (a bow) to the full, to draw and gather (a curtain); to strain (one's voice)

content:
ひきしまる〔引締まる〕
〈自動〉To tighten; to become tight; to become stringent

content.content: 金融が引き締まる
The money-market grows tight―becomes stringent.
引き締まりの金融市場
a tight money-market―a stringent money-market

content:
ひきしめる〔引締める〕
〈他動〉To tighten (a rope, etc.)

content.content: 心を引き締める
to brace oneself (up)

ひきずり〔引摺り〕
〈名〉
1. (=女の長裾)the train (of female attire)
2. (=長裾の不精女)a draggle-tailed woman; a draggle-tail; a slattern; a slut; a drab; a dowdy; a trollop

content:
ひきずりこむ〔引摺り込む〕
〈他動〉To drag in

content.content: 女を引きずり込む
to drag a woman into bed
彼はどこの馬の骨かわからぬ奴を引きずり込んで女房にしている
He has married a woman from off the streets.

content:
ひきずりだす〔引摺り出す〕
〈他動〉To drag out

content.content: 彼を寝床の中から引きずり出した
I dragged him out of bed.

ひきずりまわす〔引摺り廻す〕
〈他動〉To drag (anything) about

content:
ひきずる〔引摺る〕
〈他動〉To drag, draggle (anything); to trail (a long skirt)

content.content: 足を引きずって歩く
to drag oneself along
君は帯を引きずっている
You are trailing your sash―Your sash is trailing.

ひきたおす〔引倒す〕
〈他動〉To pull down (a house, etc.)

content:
ひきだし〔抽斗〕
〈名〉A drawer

content.content: 上の(中の、下の)抽斗にある
You will find it in the upper drawer―in the middle drawer―in the lower drawer.
箪笥の抽斗
the drawers of a chest
抽斗をあける
to open a drawer
抽斗をしめる
to shut a drawer

content:
ひきだす〔引出す〕
〈他動〉To draw (a pistol); to pull out (a handkerchief); to lead out (a horse); to drag out (a prisoner)

content.content: 銀行から金を引出す
to draw money from a bank
貯金を引出す
to draw one's savings
この頃は預け入れる者より引出す者の方が多い
More people draw money than deposit it.
厩から馬を引出す
to lead a horse out of the stable
被告を法廷へ引出した
They brought the prisoner into court―dragged the prisoner into court.

content:
ひきたつ〔引き立つ〕
〈自動〉
1. To cheer up; to become active

content.content: 気が引き立つ
to cheer up―rouse up
今日は気の引き立たない日だ
I feel dull―feel languid―feel depressed―feel out of sorts―today.
彼は気の引き立たない性質だ
He is of a dull disposition―of a heavy disposition―of a sluggish disposition―of a phlegmatic temperament.
商況が引き立つ
Trade becomes active―becomes brisk.
人気が引き立ってきた
The market is active―The market is brisk.
人気が引き立たない
The market is dull―heavy―languid―slack―stagnant.

content:
ひきたて〔引き立て〕
〈名〉
1. Favour; patronage:(=る) to favour, patronize, assist (an inferior); to put (one) forward, push (one) forward (in the world)

content.content: 毎度お引き立てに預かりましてありがとう存じます
I must thank you for your favours.
これが私の長男です、どうぞお引き立てを願います
This is my eldest son. I wish you would put him forward in the world.
私が店を引受けましたからどうぞお引き立てを願います
I have taken over the business, and I hope you will patronize me.
後進を引き立てる
to assist one's juniors―patronize one's juniors―push one's juniors forward
人の気を引き立てる
to cheer one up―rouse one up―stir one up
犯人を引き立てる
to march one off―walk one off―to the police-station
犯人は神妙に引き立てられて行った
The culprit suffered himself to be marched off.

content:
ひきつぎ〔引継ぎ〕
〈名〉Succession; taking over charge

content.content: 事務引継ぎ
taking over charge of an office

content:
ひきつぐ〔引き継ぐ〕
〈他動〉To succeed (to an office―a person in his office); to take one's place; to take over (one's duties, etc.)

content.content: 誰が君の後は引き継ぐようになりますか
Who will succeed to your office?―succeed you in your office?―be your successor?―take your place?
事務を引き継ぐ
to take over charge of an office
職務を引き継ぐ
to take over one's duties

ひきつけ〔引付け〕
〈名〉A convulsive fit (of children)

content:
ひきつける〔引き付ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=引く)to attract (people); to draw (an audience)

content.content: あの人の演説は人を引きつける力がある
He draws large audiences―attracts great crowds.

content: 2. (=魅する)to charm; to bewitch; to captivate; to fascinate

content.content: あの婦人は人を引きつける力がある
She has the power of fascinating people―She is fascinating.

content: 〈自動〉(=子どもが痙攣を起こす)to have a convulsive fit

ひきつづいて〔引続いて〕
〈副〉Continuously; uninterruptedly; without intermission; at a stretch

content.content: 彼は幾日も引き続いて断食する
He fasts for days on end.
三度引き続いて勝った
I won three times running.
僕は六時間引き続いて働く
I work six hours at a stretch.
彼らは何時間も引き続いて水に入っている
They keep in the water for hours together.
僕は十年引き続いてこの著述に従事している
I have been engaged on this work for ten years―these ten years.
あれから引き続いてここにおります
I have been here ever since.
それから引き続いて騒動が起こった
A disturbance ensued.
戦争があるとそれに引き続いていろいろな悪いことがあるものだ
Many evils will follow in the train of war.

ひきつづき〔引き続き〕
〈名〉Continuation
〈副〉Continuously

ひきつづく〔引き続く〕
〈自動〉To continue

ひきつり〔引き釣り〕
〈名〉A cramp; a spasm

content:
ひきつる〔引き釣る〕
〈自動〉To have a cramp; to have a spasm

content.content: 横腹がひきつる
I have a twitch in the side―a twinge in the side.
彼は足がひきつると言っている
He complains of a cramp in the leg.

content:
ひきつれる〔引き連れる〕
〈他動〉To take, bring, have (somebody) with one

content.content: 彼は家族を引き連れて行った
He has taken his family with him.
家族を引連れて来た
He has brought his family with him.
妻子を引き連れておった
He had his wife and family with him.
妻子を引き連れた花見に行った
He took his wife and family to see the blossoms.
細君を引き連れて洋行した
He took his wife abroad.

ひきて〔引手〕
〈名〉The handle (of a drawer); the catch (of a sliding-door):(西洋戸の丸い引き手は)a knob

ひきて〔弾手〕
〈名〉The player, the performer (on the samisen, etc.)

ひきてぢゃや〔引手茶屋〕
〈名〉A tea-house in communication with high-class brothels

ひきでもの〔引出物〕
〈名〉A present (made at a banquet); a box of pastry (served for ornament, to be taken home by the guest)

content:
ひきとめる〔引留める〕
〈他動〉
1. To detain, keep, buttonhole (a person); to hold (one) by the button
2.

content.content: 馬を引きとめる
to pull up a horse
息を引きとめる
to catch one's breath

content:
ひきとりにん〔引取人〕
〈名〉A claimant

content.content: 死骸の引き取り人が無い
No one claims the remains.
死骸は引き取り人の無き為仮埋葬された
The body, being claimed by nobody, was temporarily buried.

content:
ひきとる〔引取る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=引受ける)to take charge of (a person or thing); to claim (one's remains); to take over (a child); to take back (an article)

content.content: 僕が孤児を引き取って世話をしよう
I will take charge of the orphan.
彼は生まれた子を引き取ると言っている
He says he will take over the child born.
死骸を引き取る者が無い
No one claims his remains.
三日以内なら品物を引き取ります
We shall take back the article (and return the money) if it is brought back within three days.
嫁を親元へ引き取った
The bride was taken back by her parents.
息を引き取る
to breathe one's last―expire

content: 〈自動〉(=引下がる)to retire; to withdraw; to leave; to take oneself off; to make oneself scarce

content.content: ご用が無ければいつでも引き取ります
If you do not want me, I am ready to retire―ready to withdraw.
どうぞお引き取りを願います
I wish you would leave me.
すぐに引き取れ
Take yourself off―Make yourself scarce―at once!

ひきぬく〔引抜く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=抜去する)to pull out (a hair); to pull up (weeds); to root up, uproot (a tree)
2. (=抜擢する)to pick out, single out, select (the best); to choose (from among many―one or two out of the number)

content:
ひきのばす〔引延ばす〕
〈他動〉
1. To stretch (india-rubber); to draw out (a wire); to draw (a piece of metal into a wire); to beat out (gold); to spin out (a story); to prolong (pleasure); to extend (a line); to expand (a composition); to enlarge (a photograph)

content.content: 引延し写真
an enlarged photograph

content:
2. (=延引する)to delay, procrastinate, put off (anything to be done)
3. (=延期する)to postpone, defer, put off (a matter)

ひきはがす〔引き剥がす〕
〈他動〉To tear off (wall-paper); to rip off (boarding); to strip off (the bark of a tree); to tear up, rip up (the floor); to take up (the carpet)

content:
ひきはずす〔引き外す〕
〈他動〉
1. To pull (a door) out of place
2.

content.content: 打込む太刀を引きはずす
to dodge a blow

content:
ひきはなす〔引き離す〕
〈他動〉To pull (persons or things) apart; to separate

content.content: 飽かぬ仲を引き離す
to separate lovers

content:
ひきはらう〔引き払う〕
〈自他動〉To vacate, evacuate (a house); to leave, quit(a place); to clear out

content.content: この家を引き払ってもらいたい
I wish you to vacate the house―I wish you to quit.
早速引き払います
I will clear out at once.

content:
ひきふだ〔引札〕
〈名〉A handbill; a circular

content.content: 引札を配る
to distribute handbills

ひきふね〔曳船〕
〈名〉(事)towing:(曳く船)a tug; a tugboat:(=する) to tow (a ship); to take (a ship) in tow

content:
ひきまど〔引窓〕
〈名〉A skylight (with a sliding shutter)

content.content: 泥棒は引窓から入った
The burglar entered by the skylight.

content:
ひきまとめる〔引纏める〕
〈他動〉To gather, bring together (scattered things)

content.content: 明日は家財を引きまとめて引越して来る
I shall move here with all my belongings―bag and baggage―tomorrow.

content:
ひきまわし〔引廻し〕
〈名〉
1. (=罪人をまわすこと)leading (a criminal) on horseback through the streets
2. (=指導)guidance

content.content: よろしくお引き廻しを願います
I shall place myself under your guidance.

content: 3. (=一種の外套)a kind of mantle

ひきまわす〔引き廻す〕
〈他動〉To draw around; to lead about

content.content: 幕を引き廻す
to draw a curtain around
山車{だし}を引き廻す
to draw a festival-car about the town
罪人を引き廻す
to lead a criminal on horseback through the streets
お七は痩馬に乗せて市中を引き廻された
OShichi was led on a jade through the streets.

content:
ひきむく〔引剥く〕
〈他動〉To strip (the bark from a tree); to strip off (the bark of a tree)

content.content: 面の皮を引むいてやる
I will humiliate him―put him out of countenance―put him to the blush―put him to shame.

content:
ひきもきらず〔引きも切らず〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ひっきらず〔引切らず〕
ここは遊山客引きも切らず
The place attracts an unceasing stream of pleasure-seekers.

content:
ひきもどす〔引戻す〕

content:
ひきもの〔挽物〕
〈名〉(=挽物細工)Turnery

content.content: 挽物細工の玩具
turned toys

ひきものし〔挽物師〕
〈名〉A turner

content:
ひきゃく〔飛脚〕
〈名〉An express messenger

content.content: 飛脚をたてる
to despatch an express messenger

ひきゅう〔貔貅〕
〈名〉
1. (=勇士)a brave warrior
2. (=軍隊)troops

content:
びきょ〔美挙〕
〈名〉A noble project; a noble undertaking; good work

content.content: こんな美挙があっても賛成する者が無い
Nobody takes interest in such good work.

content:
ひきょう〔卑怯〕
〈形〉Cowardly; recreant; dastardly; sneaking; foul; unfair

content.content: 卑怯なり
That is unfair―That is not fair.
闇討とは卑怯なり
This is foul play.
君は卑怯だネ
You are a coward.
敵に後ろを見せるとは卑怯だ
It is cowardly of your to turn your back to the enemy.
卑怯を働く
to act the coward―desert one's post―desert one's trust―shirk one's duty
晴れの場で卑怯は働けぬ
One can not act the coward before a cloud of witnesses.
卑怯を働くな
Do not desert your post!―Don't give up your ship!
あれは卑怯者だ
He is a coward―a poltroon―a dastard―a craven―a recreant.
卑怯未練な奴
You coward!―You recreant!―You sneak!
卑怯未練な振舞をするな
Do not act the coward!―Do not show the white feather!

content:
ひきょう〔悲境〕
〈名〉Distressing circumstances; distress

content.content: 彼は悲境に陥っている
He is in distress.

ひきよせる〔引寄せる〕
〈他動〉To draw (anything) toward one

content:
ひぎり〔日切り〕
〈形〉Due by some fixed date

content.content: あれは日切りの金だ
The money must be paid by a fixed date.
日切りの仕事で忙しい
We are busy with some work which must be finished by a fixed date.

content:
ひきわけ〔引分け〕
〈名〉A drawn game; a draw

content.content: 相撲が引分けになった
The match ended in a draw.

content:
ひきわける〔引分ける〕
〈他動〉To part (the parties); to get between (the parties); to draw, pull (the parties) apart

content.content: けんかを引分ける
to part the combatants―get between the combatants

content:
ひきわたし〔引渡し〕
〈名〉Delivery (of prisoners); transfer (of property); surrender (of property to creditors); extradition (of a refugee)

content.content: 亡命者引き渡し
extradition

content:
ひきわたす〔引渡す〕
〈他動〉
1. To hand over, deliver over (a man to the police); to make over, transfer (one's property to another); to turn over, transfer, surrender (a business to one's creditor); to give up, deliver up, resign, surrender (one's rights to another); to deliver over, extradite (a refugee to the foreign government)

content.content: 暴漢を警察へ引き渡した
We have handed over the ruffian―delivered over the ruffian―given the ruffian in charge―given the ruffian in custody―to the police.
死骸は遺族に引き渡された
His remains were handed over to his family.
彼は財産を息子に引き渡して隠居した
He has made over his property―transferred his property―to his son, and retired from active life.
彼は店を債権者に引き渡してしまった
He has turned over his business―surrendered his business―to his creditors.
亡命者は本国官憲に引き渡す
to extradite a refugee

content: 2. (=張る)to stretch (a rope across the street―a rope between two points.)

〈名〉Barley meal

ひきわる〔挽き割る〕
〈他動〉To saw (timber) into (boards, etc.)

ひきわる〔碾き割る〕
〈他動〉To grind (barley) into meal

content:
ひきん〔卑近〕
〈形〉Familiar

content.content: 卑近な言葉を使う
to use familiar language
卑近な例を挙げる
to give familiar examples
卑近にわかりやすく説く
to explain in familiar and easy language

ひきんぞく〔卑金属〕
〈名〉Base metals

ひきんぞく〔非金属〕
〈名〉A non-metal; a non-metallic element; a metalloid

content:
ひく〔引く、曳く〕
〈他動〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. To draw

content.content: 息を曳く
to draw breath―inspire
車を曳く
to draw a cart
馬が馬車を曳く
A horse draws a carriage.
寒国では犬に橇を曳かせる
In cold countries, the sledges are drawn by dogs.
弓を引く
to draw a bow―bend a bow
幕を引く
to draw a curtain
綱を引く
to draw a net―haul a net
籤を引く
to draw lots―draw cuts―cast lots
当たり籤を引く
to draw a prize
空籤を引く
to draw a blank―sit down a blank
線を引く
to draw a line
棒を引く、墨を引く
to draw a line―(字を消すの意味なら)―strike out a word―cross out a word―(帳消しの意味なら)―cross off accounts―cancel accounts
図を引く
to draw a plan―make a drawing
地図を引く
to draw a map
注意を引く
to draw attention―attract attention
人を引く
to draw people―(演説や興行物なら)―draw large audiences―(店なら)―draw customers
敵の砲火を引く
to draw the enemy's fire
水を引く
to draw water―conduct water
我田に水を引く
“Every miller draws the water to his own mill.”
手綱を引いて馬を留める
to draw rein
あの店では安く売って客を引く
That shop draws customers by selling cheap.
客を引く(客引きをする)
to tout

content: 2. To pull

content.content: 綱を引く
to pull a rope―(綱をかけて引くのなら)―pull at the rope
馬の手綱を引く
to pull the reins―(手綱を引いて馬を留めるのなら)―draw rein―pull up―(手綱を引いて歩くのなら)―lead a horse by the bride
袖を引く
to pull one by the sleeve―pluck one by the sleeve―(西洋風に言えば)―hold one by the button―buttonhole one
(彼と別れた時は)後ろ髪を引かれるようだった
I felt myself pulled by the hair from behind―I felt a tug at parting.
引金を引く
to pull the trigger
一ト引き引く
to give a pull

content: 3. To attract

content.content: 磁石は鉄を引く
The magnet attract iron.
注意を引く
to attract attention―draw attention
この問題が世間の注意を引いている
The question is attracting public attention―The question is at the front.
人目を引く
to attract notice

content: 4. To lead (a horse)

content.content: 馬を引く
to lead a horse
馬の手綱を引く
to lead a horse by the bridle
盲人の手を引く
to lead a blindman by the hand
女が子どもの手を引いている
The woman is leading the child by the hand.
牛に引かれて善光寺詣り
“making a virtue of necessity.”

content: 5. To haul (a net)

content.content: 綱を引く
to hand a net―draw a net
綱を引いて死骸を捜索する
to drag the sea or river for bodies
綱を引いて死骸を探した
We dragged the sea for the body―The sea was dragged for the body.

content: 6. To tow (a ship)

content.content: 船を曳く
to tow a ship―tow a boat
親船が伝馬を曳いている
The junk is towing a boat―The junk has a boat in tow.
帆船を曳き船に曳かして河を上った
The ship was towed by a tug up the river―tugged up the river.
機関に故障を生じたから僚艦に曳いてもらった
The engine broke down, and our consort took us in tow.

content: 7. To cite (authorities); to quote (Shakespeare, etc.)

content.content: 例を引く
to cite an instance
大家の言を引く(誰某曰くと言う)
to cite authorities
先生は沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の言を引くことが好きだ
He likes to quote Shakespeare―quote from Shakespeare.
古事を引く
to allude to a historical fact

content: 8. To reduce (the price)

content.content: 値を引く
to reduce the price―abate the price―lesson the price―lower the price―make it cheaper―take something off the price
いくらか引けないか
Can't you take something off the price?―take off something?
五十銭だけ引いておきます
I will take off fifty sen―Knock off fifty sen―come down fifty sen.
一銭も引けません
I can not take a cent less.
現金なら一割引きます
We shall take off ten percent, for cash.
先方では要求額を一文も引かない
The other party will not bate a jot of their demands.

content: 9. To subtract (one number from another)

content.content: 十から三引く
subtract 3 from 10
十から三引けば七残る
3 from 10 leaves 7.
水道をひく
to lay on city-water―have city-water laid on
水道の水は多摩川からひいてある
The water-works are supplied by the Tamagawa.
ガスをひく
to lay on gas―have gas laid on
お宅にはガスがひいてありますか
Have you gas laid on?
電話をひく
to install the telephone―have the telephone installed
電灯をひく
to install electric lights―have electric lights installed
教室には電灯がひいてある
The class-rooms are lighted with electric lights―lighted by electricity.
油をひく
to cover anything with oil
靴に油をひく
to oil boots―grease boots
蝋をひく
to coat anything with wax
床に蝋をひく
to wax the floor
綱に渋をひく
to tan a net
同情を引く
to win sympathy
彼は不幸に逢って世間の同情を引いた
His misfortune won him public sympathy.
好奇心を引く
to excite one's curiosity
字を引く
to look up a word in a dictionary
むつかしい言葉を引いておけ
Look up all the hard words.
この語を引いても字引に無い
I could not find the word in the dictionary.
字引を引く
to consult a dictionary―refer to a dictionary
字引の引き方も知らない
They do not know how to use a dictionary.
花を引く
to play (at) cards
一座は花を引いている
The company are playing cards―at cards.
行ってみると彼らは花を引いておった
I found them at cards.
時々花を引いて夜を明かす
They often play the night out.
風邪をひく
to take cold―catch cold
僕は風邪をひいている、悪い風邪を引いた
I have a cold―I have a bad cold.
風邪をひいているから出られぬ
I have a cold, and so I must keep indoors―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My cold keeps me indoors.
今は風邪をひきやすい時だ
Now is the worst time for colds.
血を引く
to run in the blood
ある病は血を引く、血筋を引く、血統を引く
Certain diseases run in the blood―run in the family.
誰の血を引く
to be descended from some one
彼は偉い人の血を引いている、血統を引いている、系統を引いている
He is descended from a great man―He traces his descent to a great man.
島人は日本人の血を引いている
The islanders are descended from Japanese―of Japanese descent―of Japanese blood―of Japanese lineage―of Japanese extraction.
僕はあの人と縁を引いている
I am connected with him.
手を引く
to back out (of the scheme)―beg off―cry off―declare off
そんな仕事はご免をこうむると言って皆手を引いた
Everybody excused himself from the task―begged off the task―cried off the task.
約束を履行するのがいやになって手を引いた者がある
Some declared off the engagement.
そんな事件はご免だから僕は手を引く
I wash my hands of the affair―I cry off.
身を引く
to retire―resign
こうなったからは僕が身を引くよりほかは無い
Under these circumstances, there is nothing for it but to resign―there is no alternative left me but resignation.
気を引く
to try one's temper―(勇気を試すの意味なら)―test one's courage―(意見を探るの意味なら)―sound one's views
そう言って気を引いてみたのさ
I said so to put his courage to the test.
責めを引く
to take the responsibility on oneself
大臣が責めを引いて辞職するのが当然だ
The Minister ought to take the responsibility upon himself and resign.
女が裾を引く
A woman trails her skirt―(悪く言えば)―draggles her tail
山が南の方へ裾を引いている
The mountain sweeps to the southward.
島が東の方へ根を引いている
The island sweeps to the eastward.
流星は光りの尾を引く
A meteor leaves a tail of light behind it.
勝負事は後を引く
Sporting becomes a habit.
あの人の酒は後を引く
He sits long over his wine―“tarries long at his wine.”
杖をひく
to take a walk―have a stroll―have a ramble
日曜などには郊外に杖をひくことがある
I something go of a Sunday for a ramble outside the city.
膳を引く(に相当するは)
to clear the table
引札を引く
to distribute handbills
びっこを引く
to limp―halt―dot and go one
魚が引く
A fish bites.
魚か引いた
I have a bite.

血を引く
to run in the blood
ある病は血を引く、血筋を引く、血統を引く
Certain diseases run in the blood―run in the family.
誰の血を引く
to be descended from some one
彼は偉い人の血を引いている、血統を引いている、系統を引いている
He is descended from a great man―He traces his descent to a great man.
島人は日本人の血を引いている
The islanders are descended from Japanese―of Japanese descent―of Japanese blood―of Japanese lineage―of Japanese extraction.
僕はあの人と縁を引いている
I am connected with him.
手を引く
to back out (of the scheme)―beg off―cry off―declare off
そんな仕事はご免をこうむると言って皆手を引いた
Everybody excused himself from the task―begged off the task―cried off the task.
約束を履行するのがいやになって手を引いた者がある
Some declared off the engagement.
そんな事件はご免だから僕は手を引く
I wash my hands of the affair―I cry off.
身を引く
to retire―resign
こうなったからは僕が身を引くよりほかは無い
Under these circumstances, there is nothing for it but to resign―there is no alternative left me but resignation.
気を引く
to try one's temper―(勇気を試すの意味なら)―test one's courage―(意見を探るの意味なら)―sound one's views
そう言って気を引いてみたのさ
I said so to put his courage to the test.
責めを引く
to take the responsibility on oneself
大臣が責めを引いて辞職するのが当然だ
The Minister ought to take the responsibility upon himself and resign.
女が裾を引く
A woman trails her skirt―(悪く言えば)―draggles her tail
山が南の方へ裾を引いている
The mountain sweeps to the southward.
島が東の方へ根を引いている
The island sweeps to the eastward.
流星は光りの尾を引く
A meteor leaves a tail of light behind it.
勝負事は後を引く
Sporting becomes a habit.
あの人の酒は後を引く
He sits long over his wine―“tarries long at his wine.”
杖をひく
to take a walk―have a stroll―have a ramble
日曜などには郊外に杖をひくことがある
I something go of a Sunday for a ramble outside the city.
膳を引く(に相当するは)
to clear the table
引札を引く
to distribute handbills
びっこを引く
to limp―halt―dot and go one
魚が引く
A fish bites.
魚か引いた
I have a bite.

content:
ひく〔退く〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=引退する)to retire (from the profession)

content.content: 親父は役所を退きました
My father has retired from office.
彼は政界を退いて故山に晩年を送っている
He has retired from the political world, and passes the evening of his life in the seat of his infancy.
あの子はもう退きました
She has retired (from the profession).

content: 2. (=減退する)to ebb; to abate; to subside; to fall; to go down

content.content: 潮が退く
The tide ebbs.
潮が退いている
The tide is ebbing―on the ebb.
潮が退いた
The tide has ebbed―The tide has left the beach dry―It is low tide―It is low water.
水が退いた
The flood has subsided―The river has gone down.
水が六尺退いた
The river has gone down (by) six feet.
熱が退いた
The fever has abated.
腫れが退いた
The swelling has gone down.

content: 3. (=後へ退く)to retreat; recede; to fall back

content.content: こうなっては退くに退かれぬ
I have gone too far to retreat.
あの場合退くに退かれなかった
I was in for it.
君はこの場に至って後へは退けぬ
You can not recede at the eleventh hour.
人に頼まれれば後へは退かぬ
I never recede from an engagement.
彼はいったん言い出したら後へは退かない質だ
He never swerves from his resolutions.
言い出した以上は後へは退かぬ
Since I have said it, I must act up to it―I must act up to my resolution.
一歩後へ退く
to take a step backward
一歩も退かぬ
We will hold out ground―stand our ground.
一歩退くにもただは退かぬ
We will contest every inch of the ground―dispute every inch of the ground.
互いに一歩も退かぬ
They will not yield an inch to each other.

content:
ひく〔弾く〕
〈他動〉To play (the piano―on the piano)

content.content: あの町では三味線くらい弾けない女は無い
In that town, every woman plays the samisen.
絃を弾く
to play on a string-instrument―twang the lyre

content:
ひく〔挽く〕
〈他動〉To saw (wood)

content.content: 丸太を挽いて板にする
to saw a long into boards
この木は挽きやすい、挽きにくい
This wood saws easily―saws hard.
櫛を挽く
to cut the teeth of a comb
櫛の歯を挽くよう
They come in rapid succession―quickly one after another.

content:
ひく〔碾く〕
〈他動〉To grind (corn)

content.content: 小麦をひいて粉にする
We grind wheat into flour―Wheat is ground into flour.
お茶をひく
(said of a professional singer, when) she is without an engagement for the evening.

content:
ひく〔轢く〕
〈他動〉To run over (a child, etc.)

content.content: 子どもが自動車に轢かれた
A child was run over by a motor-car.

びく〔魚籃〕
〈名〉A fisherman's basket; a creel

content:
ひくい〔低い〕
〈形〉
1. Low

content.content: 枝が低く垂れている
The branches hang low.
天低し地狭し
The heavens are not high enough for me, nor is the earth wide enough for me.
低きより高きに登る
to climb ［mount］ from the low to the high
高きに登るは低きよりす
“He who would climb the ladder must begin at the bottom.”
あの学校は程度が低い
The school is of a low grade.
程度の低い学校
a low-grade school
山の低い帽子
a low-crowned hat
中学校の英語は程度が低い
The English of the middle school is of a low standard.
程度を低くする
to lower the grade―lower the standard
調子が低い
The pitch is low.
彼は身分が低い
He is of a low social position.
身分の低い人
a humble individual
あの先生は声が低い
His voice is low―He speaks in a low voice.
低い声で話す
to talk in a low voice―in a subdued tone
声を低くする
to lower one's voice―drop one's voice―subdue one's voice

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの人は背が低い
He is short of stature.
背の低い人
a short man
あの女は鼻が低い
She has a flat nose.
鼻の低い女
a flat-nosed woman
あの人は頭が低い
He is humble―lowly.
腰が低い
He is condescending―civil―polite.
来て見れば聞くより低し富士の峯
It does not come up to my expectations―It falls short of my expectations.

ひくいどり〔火食鳥〕
〈名〉The cassowary

ひぐち〔樋口〕
〈名〉A sluice; a floodgate

content:
ひくつ〔卑屈〕
〈形〉Spiritless; poor-spirited; mean-spirited; servile; sneaking

content.content: 卑屈者
a spiritless fellow―a servile creature―a sneak
あれは卑屈者だ
He has no spirit―He can't say bo! to a goose.
侮辱を受けて黙っているような卑屈者だ
He has no spirit to resent an insult.
そんな卑屈な精神じゃいかん
Away with such a servile spirit!

びくつく
〈自動〉To be nervous; to be timorous

content:
びくともせぬ
〈自動〉To be unmoved; to be immovable; to be imperturbable

content.content: 彼はびくともせずに大手術を受けた
He would not move a muscle of his face under the hands of the surgeon―He submitted to the painful operation without moving a muscle of his face.
どんな危険に臨んでもびくともせぬ
He would not turn a hair in the presence of any danger.
びくともせずに死刑の宣告をうけた
He listened to his sentence of his death without wincing―without flinching.
この家はどんな風が吹いてもびくともせぬ
This house will stand any gale―defy any storm.
びくともしない面魂{つらだましい}
an unmoved countenance

content:
びくに〔比丘尼〕
〈名〉A Buddhist nun

content.content: それは比丘尼に何やら出せというようなものだ(できない相談)
That's asking the impossible.

content:
びくびく
〈名〉Trembling for fear:(=する) to tremble for fear; to be in fear and trembling; to quake for fear; to shake in one's shoes; to be nervous; to be timid; to be timorous

content.content: 皆叱られるかと思ってびくびくしている
They tremble lest they should catch it.
そうびくびくすることはない
You need not be so nervous.

content:
びくびくもの
〈名〉Living in fear; going in fear (of one's life)

content.content: 大地震の後は一週間ばかりというものはびくびくもので暮らした
We lived in fear of our lives for about a week after the great earthquake.

content:
ひぐらし〔日暮し〕
〈名〉
1. Passing one's time

content.content: どうして日暮らしをする
How do you pass your time?―spend your time?―(米国では)―put in your time?
読書をして日暮らしをする
I spend my time in reading―devote my time to reading.
老人は読書と庭いじりに日暮らしをしている
The old man divides his time―passes his time―between the library and the garden.
その日暮らし
a hand-to-mouth existence―(する)―to live from hand to mouth

content: 2. (=蝉)a kind of cicada (which sings in the morning and evening)

びくりとする
〈自動〉To start; to give a start

content.content: 名を呼ばれた時びくりとした
On hearing myself called by name, I give a start.
二人は顔を見合わしてびくりとした
Their eyes met, and they started.

ひぐるま〔向日葵〕
〈名〉The sunflower

content:
ひぐれ〔日暮れ〕
〈名〉Nightfall; sunset; sundown; dusk

content.content: 日暮れに着いた
I arrived at nightfall―at sunset―at sundown.
日暮れ前に行けるだろうか
Can we get there before dark?
日暮れ後になる
We shall get there after dark.

content:
ひけ〔引け〕
〈名〉
1. (=退出)close (of office-hours, school-hours, etc.)

content.content: 役所は四時に引けです
The office closes at four.

content: 2. (=廓の引け)close of the evening's business; midnight

content.content: 間夫は引け過ぎ
The fancy-man comes in after the evening's business is done―“Business first, pleasure afterwards.”

content: 3. (=座敷の引け)retirement for the night

content.content: お引けにしましょう
Let us retire for the night―retire to repose.

content: 4. (=負け、後れ)a defeat; a retreat; backwardness

content.content: 引けをとる
to be beaten―unable to hold one's ground
日本は何国に対しても引けをとらぬ
Japan can hold her own against any power.
彼はどこへ行っても引けをとらぬ
Whenever he may go, he can assert his own.
僕は熱心では引けをとらぬ
I am not behind the others in zeal―I yield to no man in zeal.

content: 5. (=損)loss

content.content: そうお安く売っては引けがたちます
If we sell so cheap, we shall lose.

content:
ひげ〔卑下〕
〈名〉Self-abasement; self-depreciation; self-effacement; humility:(=する) to humble oneself; to depreciate oneself; to abase oneself; to efface oneself; to think meanly of oneself

content.content: 卑下は自慢の中
Too much humility is a sort of pride.

content:
ひげ〔髯、髭〕
〈名〉(顎髯は)a beard; a goatee; an imperial:(口髭は)a moustache:(頬髯は)whiskers:(動物の髯は)whiskers

content.content: 彼は髯を生やしている
He wears a beard.
髭を生やそうとしている
He is trying to grow a moustache.
髯を撫でる
to stroke one's beard
髭をひねる
to twirl one's moustache
濃い髯
a heavy beard―a thick beard
薄い髯
a light beard―a thin beard
つけ髭
a false-moustache
つけ髯をする
to disguise oneself with a false beard
つけ髯をしていた
He was disguised with a false beard.
お髯の塵を払う
to pay court to―curry favour with―dance attendance on―toady―a great personage

content:
ひげ〔髯、髭〕
〈名〉(顎髯は)a beard; a goatee; an imperial:(口髭は)a moustache:(頬髯は)whiskers:(動物の髯は)whiskers

content.content: 彼は髯を生やしている
He wears a beard.
髭を生やそうとしている
He is trying to grow a moustache.
髯を撫でる
to stroke one's beard
髭をひねる
to twirl one's moustache
濃い髯
a heavy beard―a thick beard
薄い髯
a light beard―a thin beard
つけ髭
a false-moustache
つけ髯をする
to disguise oneself with a false beard
つけ髯をしていた
He was disguised with a false beard.
お髯の塵を払う
to pay court to―curry favour with―dance attendance on―toady―a great personage

content:
ひけい〔秘計〕
〈名〉A secret scheme

content.content: 相手はなにか秘計がありそうだ
My man seems to be playing a deep game.

びけい〔美形〕
〈名〉A pretty girl

びけい〔美景〕
〈名〉Beautiful scenery; a beautiful prospect

content:
ひげき〔悲劇〕
〈名〉A tragedy:(=の) tragic; tragical

content.content: 一場の悲劇を演ずる
to enact a tragedy
悲劇作者
a tragic writer―a tragedian
悲劇俳優
a tragic actor―a tragedian
悲劇女優
a tragedienne

びげき〔尾撃〕
〈名〉Pursuit; chase:(=する) to pursue, start in pursuit of (the enemy); to chase, give chase to (an enemy ship)

content:
ひけし〔火消し〕
〈名〉A fireman

content.content: 火消頭
a head-fireman
火消組
a fire company―a fire brigade

ひけしつぼ〔火消壺〕
〈名〉A pot for extinguishing embers
